original: bla mar mdzad pa dang / bsti stang du mdzad pa dang / mchod par mdzad pa dang / rjed par mdzad pa dang / bkur stir mdzad pa dang / rjes su 'dzin par 'dzad pa dang / yongs su bsrung bar mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bla mar mdzad pa dang / bsti stang du mdzad pa dang / mchod par mdzad pa dang / rjed par mdzad pa dang / bkur stir mdzad pa dang / rjes su 'dzin par 'dzad pa dang / yongs su bsrung bar mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the ones who have made the Tathāgata their guru, have honored him, have made offerings to him, have revered him, have shown him respect, have sustained him, and have protected him.

original: rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pas byas pa mkhyen pa dang byas pa rig par blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni gus par bya ba la sogs pas shes pa yin no ;🔽/ rab 'byor gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas byed pa po med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pas byas pa mkhyen pa dang byas pa rig par blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni gus par bya ba la sogs pas shes pa yin no ; / rab 'byor gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas byed pa po med pa'i phyir /
translated: Subhūti, the Tathāgata knows and is aware of those who have done something.

original: chos thams cad ma byas zhes bya bar mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: chos thams cad ma byas zhes bya bar mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
translated: Subhūti, the Tathāgata has fully awakened to the fact that all phenomena are unmade because there is no maker.

original: lus med pa'i phyir ma byas zhes bya bar mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: lus med pa'i phyir ma byas zhes bya bar mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
translated: He has fully awakened to the fact that they are unmade because they have no body.

original: rab 'byor 'di yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i byas pa mkhyen pa dang / byas pa rig par blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni byed pa med pa can shes pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i byas pa mkhyen pa dang / byas pa rig par blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni byed pa med pa can shes pa yin no //
translated: This too, Subhūti, is the Tathāgata’s knowledge of what has been done and knowledge of what has not been done.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten te /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten te /
translated: Subhūti, moreover, based on the perfection of wisdom,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i byed pa med pa can shes pa chos thams cad la 'jug pa med pa'i brdas 'jug ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i byed pa med pa can shes pa chos thams cad la 'jug pa med pa'i brdas 'jug ste /
translated: the Tathāgata’s knowledge of what has not been done engages with all phenomena by the sign of non-engagement.

original: rab 'byor rnam grangs des na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor rnam grangs des na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: Subhūti, by this one of many explanations the perfection of wisdom is the producer of the Tathāgata🔽and the one who shows this world.”

original: 'jig rten 'di ston par byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni thams cad du 'gro ba shes pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di ston par byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni thams cad du 'gro ba shes pa yin no //
translated: This is the knowledge of the all-pervading.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: bcom ldan 'das gang gi tshe chos thams cad shes pa po ma mchis shing mthong ba po ma mchis pa @226a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang gi tshe chos thams cad shes pa po ma mchis shing mthong ba po ma mchis pa @226a * //
translated: “Blessed One, when all phenomena are without a knower and without a seer,

original: de'i tshe ji ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de bzhin gshegs pa skyed par byed pa lags /
analyzed: de'i tshe ji ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de bzhin gshegs pa skyed par byed pa lags /
translated: At that time, how is the perfection of wisdom the producer of the Tathāgata?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor de de bzhin no //
translated: “Subhūti, it is so!

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said.

original: chos thams cad ni shes pa po med cing mthong ba po med pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni shes pa po med cing mthong ba po med pa'o //
translated: All phenomena are without a knower and without a seer.

original: rab 'byor ji ltar na chos thams cad shes pa po med cing mthong ba po med pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor ji ltar na chos thams cad shes pa po med cing mthong ba po med pa yin zhe na /
translated: Subhūti, how are all phenomena without a knower and without a seer?

original: rab 'byor chos thams cad ni stong pa gsog gsob snying po med pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor chos thams cad ni stong pa gsog gsob snying po med pa ste /
translated: Subhūti, all phenomena are empty, hollow, false, and insubstantial.

original: rab 'byor rnam grangs des na chos thams cad ni shes pa po med cing mthong ba po med pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor rnam grangs des na chos thams cad ni shes pa po med cing mthong ba po med pa'o //
translated: Subhūti, by this one of many explanations all phenomena are without a knower and without a seer.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang chos thams cad ni shes pa po med cing mthong ba po med pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang chos thams cad ni shes pa po med cing mthong ba po med pa ste /
translated: “Moreover, Subhūti, all phenomena are without a knower and without a seer.

original: rab 'byor ji ltar na chos thams cad shes pa po med cing mthong ba po med pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor ji ltar na chos thams cad shes pa po med cing mthong ba po med pa yin zhe na /
translated: Subhūti, how are all phenomena without a knower and without a seer?

original: rab 'byor chos thams cad ni mi rten cing khongs su chud pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor chos thams cad ni mi rten cing khongs su chud pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: “Subhūti, all phenomena are not based and are not included.

original: rab 'byor rnam grangs des na chos thams cad shes pa po med cing mthong ba po med pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor rnam grangs des na chos thams cad shes pa po med cing mthong ba po med pa'o //
translated: Subhūti, for this reason all phenomena are without a knower and without a seer.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: “Subhūti, in this way the perfection of wisdom gives birth to the tathāgatas.

original: 'jig rten 'di ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di ston par byed pa'o //
translated: It shows this world.

original: de yang gzugs kyi mthong ba med pa'i phyir ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de yang gzugs kyi mthong ba med pa'i phyir ston par byed pa'o //
translated: It shows it because form is not seen.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i mthong ba po med pa'i phyir ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i mthong ba po med pa'i phyir ston par byed pa'o //
translated: It shows it because feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are not seen.

original: phung po dang / khams dang skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i mthong ba med pa'i phyir ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i mthong ba med pa'i phyir ston par byed pa'o //
translated: It shows it because the aggregates, constituents, sense fields, and dependent origination are not seen.

original: de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi mthong ba med pa'i phyir ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi mthong ba med pa'i phyir ston par byed pa'o //
translated: In the same way, up to the knowledge of all modes, it is the teacher because of the non-existence of seeing.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: Thus, Subhuti, the perfection of wisdom is the producer of the Tathagata.

original: 'jig rten 'di ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di ston par byed pa'o //
translated: It is the teacher of this world.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhuti:

original: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na gzugs kyi mthong ba ma mchis pa'i slad du ston par bgyid pa lags /🔽ji ltar na tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / ji ltar na rnam par shes pa'i mthong ba po ma mchis pa'i slad du ston par bgyid par 'gyur ba lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na gzugs kyi mthong ba ma mchis pa'i slad du ston par bgyid pa lags / ji ltar na tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / ji ltar na rnam par shes pa'i mthong ba po ma mchis pa'i slad du ston par bgyid par 'gyur ba lags /
translated: How, O Lord, does the perfection of wisdom teach by reason of the non-existence of the seeing of form?🔽How does it teach by reason of the non-existence of the seeing of feeling, perception, the formative forces, and consciousness?

original: ji ltar na phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i mthong ba ma mchis pa'i slad du ston par bgyid pa lags /
analyzed: ji ltar na phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i mthong ba ma mchis pa'i slad du ston par bgyid pa lags /
translated: How does it teach by reason of the non-existence of the seeing of the skandhas, elements, sense fields, and the dependent origination?

original: ji ltar na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi mthong @226b ba ma mchis pa'i slad du ston par bgyid pa lags /🔽// / bam po bzhi bcu lnga pa /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: ji ltar na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi mthong @226b ba ma mchis pa'i slad du ston par bgyid pa lags / // / bam po bzhi bcu lnga pa / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: How is it that one teaches the non-seeing of form up to the non-seeing of the knowledge of all modes?

original: rab 'byor gang gi tshe gzugs la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa mi 'byung ba de'i tshe gzugs kyi mthong ba med pa'i phyir ston par byed pa'o //🔽de bzhin du gang gi tshe tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / gang gi tshe rnam par shes pa la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa mi 'byung ba de'i tshe rnam par shes pa mthong ba med pa'i phyir ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor gang gi tshe gzugs la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa mi 'byung ba de'i tshe gzugs kyi mthong ba med pa'i phyir ston par byed pa'o // de bzhin du gang gi tshe tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / gang gi tshe rnam par shes pa la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa mi 'byung ba de'i tshe rnam par shes pa mthong ba med pa'i phyir ston par byed pa'o //
translated: The Lord: When consciousness does not occur in the objective realm of form, then one teaches the non-seeing of form.🔽When consciousness does not occur in the objective realm of feeling, perception, will, or consciousness, then one teaches the non-seeing of consciousness.

original: gang gi tshe phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa mi 'byung ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa mi 'byung ba de'i tshe /
translated: When consciousness does not occur in the objective realm of the skandhas, elements, sense fields, or dependent origination, then one teaches the non-seeing of the skandhas, elements, sense fields, and dependent origination.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i mthong ba med pa'i phyir ston par byed pa'o //🔽gang gi tshe pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa mi 'byung ba de'i tshe pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi mthong ba med pa'i phyir ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i mthong ba med pa'i phyir ston par byed pa'o // gang gi tshe pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa mi 'byung ba de'i tshe pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi mthong ba med pa'i phyir ston par byed pa'o //
translated: It is the teacher because of the non-perception of dependent origination.🔽It is the teacher because of the non-perception of the perfections.

original: gang gi tshe stong pa nyid rnams dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun rnams dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / tshad med pa dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad rnams dang /
analyzed: gang gi tshe stong pa nyid rnams dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun rnams dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / tshad med pa dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad rnams dang /
translated: It is the teacher because of the non-perception of the emptinesses, the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, the four noble truths, the immeasurables, the concentrations, the formless absorptions, the eight liberations, the nine serial absorptions, the eight bases of subjugation, the ten universal bases, the six clairvoyances, the four individual correct knowledges, the ten powers of a Tathagata, the four fearlessnesses, the four things that need not be guarded against, the eighteen dharmas exclusive to a Buddha, the great love, and the great compassion.

original: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu rnams dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa rnams dang / mngon par shes pa lnga rnams dang / gzugs kyi sgo rnams dang /
analyzed: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu rnams dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa rnams dang / mngon par shes pa lnga rnams dang / gzugs kyi sgo rnams dang /
translated: the nine serial absorptions, the three gates of liberation, the five kinds of superknowledge, the various kinds of power, the various kinds of mental prowess, the various kinds of dhāraṇī, the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment, the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four unobstructed understandings, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang ; so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / gang gi tshe sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa mi 'byung ba de'i tshe sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi mthong ba med pa'i phyir ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang ; so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / gang gi tshe sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa mi 'byung ba de'i tshe sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi mthong ba med pa'i phyir ston par byed pa'o //
translated: When the consciousness that perceives the distinct attributes of a buddha does not occur, then the distinct attributes of a buddha are revealed because they are not seen.

original: rab 'byor gang gi tshe rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa mi 'byung ba de'i tshe rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi mthong ba med pa'i phyir ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor gang gi tshe rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa mi 'byung ba de'i tshe rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi mthong ba med pa'i phyir ston par byed pa'o //
translated: “Subhūti, when consciousness that takes the knowledge of all aspects as its object does not occur, then it is the teacher because the knowledge of all aspects is not seen.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i skyed par byed pa'o //🔽'jig rten 'di ston par byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni ma mthong @227a * //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i skyed par byed pa'o // 'jig rten 'di ston par byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni ma mthong @227a * //
translated: “Subhūti, in that way this profound perfection of wisdom is the producer of the tathāgatas🔽and the teacher of this world.”

original: ba'i don ston pa shes pa yin no //
analyzed: ba'i don ston pa shes pa yin no //
translated: This is the knowledge of teaching the meaning that is not seen.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang ji ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i skyed par byed pa dang / 'jig rten 'di ston par byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang ji ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i skyed par byed pa dang / 'jig rten 'di ston par byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, in what way is this profound perfection of wisdom the producer of the tathāgatas and the teacher of this world?

original: rab 'byor 'di la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'jig rten stong ngo zhes brjod par mdzad do //
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'jig rten stong ngo zhes brjod par mdzad do //
translated: “Subhūti, here the perfection of wisdom declares that the world is empty.

original: ji ltar 'jig rten stong ngo zhes brjod par mdzad ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'jig rten stong ngo zhes brjod par mdzad ce na /
translated: How does he declare that the world is empty?

original: phung po lnga'i 'jig rten stong ngo zhes bya bar brjod par mdzad do //
analyzed: phung po lnga'i 'jig rten stong ngo zhes bya bar brjod par mdzad do //
translated: He declares that the world of the five aggregates is empty.

original: skye mched bcu gnyis kyi 'jig rten stong ngo zhes bya bar brjod par mdzad do //
analyzed: skye mched bcu gnyis kyi 'jig rten stong ngo zhes bya bar brjod par mdzad do //
translated: He declares that the world of the twelve sense spheres is empty.

original: khams bco brgyad kyi 'jig rten stong ngo zhes bya bar brjod par mdzad do //
analyzed: khams bco brgyad kyi 'jig rten stong ngo zhes bya bar brjod par mdzad do //
translated: He declares that the world of the eighteen elements is empty.

original: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam gyi 'jig rten stong ngo zhes bya bar brjod par mdzad do //
analyzed: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam gyi 'jig rten stong ngo zhes bya bar brjod par mdzad do //
translated: He declares that the world of the ten wholesome courses of action is empty.

original: bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams kyi 'jig rten stong ngo zhes bya bar brjod par mdzad do //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams kyi 'jig rten stong ngo zhes bya bar brjod par mdzad do //
translated: He declares that the world of the four meditations, the four immeasurables, and the four formless absorptions is empty.

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis kyi 'jig rten stong ngo zhes bya bar brjod par mdzad do //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis kyi 'jig rten stong ngo zhes bya bar brjod par mdzad do //
translated: He declares that the world of the twelve members of dependent arising conditioned by ignorance is empty.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba sngon du 'gro ba can gyi lta bas byas pa drug cu rtsa gnyis kyi 'jig rten stong ngo zhes bya bar brjod par mdzad do //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba sngon du 'gro ba can gyi lta bas byas pa drug cu rtsa gnyis kyi 'jig rten stong ngo zhes bya bar brjod par mdzad do //
translated: He declares that the world is empty of the sixty-two views that are preceded by the perishable collection view.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyi 'jig rten stong ngo zhes bya bar brjod par mdzad do //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyi 'jig rten stong ngo zhes bya bar brjod par mdzad do //
translated: He declares that the world is empty of the thirty-seven factors of awakening.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi 'jig rten stong ngo zhes bya bar brjod par mdzad do //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi 'jig rten stong ngo zhes bya bar brjod par mdzad do //
translated: He declares that the world is empty of the six perfections.

original: nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / stong pa nyid stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyi 'jig rten stong ngo zhes bya bar brjod par mdzad do //
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / stong pa nyid stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyi 'jig rten stong ngo zhes bya bar brjod par mdzad do //
translated: He declares that the world is empty of the emptiness of internal phenomena, the emptiness of external phenomena, the emptiness of external and internal phenomena, the emptiness of emptiness, and so on up to the emptiness that is the nonexemption from the lack of inherent identity.

original: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang ; so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi 'jig rten stong ngo zhes bya bar brjod par mdzad do //
analyzed: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang ; so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi 'jig rten stong ngo zhes bya bar brjod par mdzad do //
translated: the ten powers, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, he declares, “The world is empty.”

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi 'jig rten stong ngo zhes bya bar brjod par mdzad do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi 'jig rten stong ngo zhes bya bar brjod par mdzad do //
translated: up to he declares, “The knowledge of all aspects is empty.”

original: rab 'byor de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di de bzhin gshegs pa skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di de bzhin gshegs pa skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: Subhūti, thus this perfection of wisdom generates the Tathāgata.

original: 'jig rten 'di ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di ston par byed pa'o //
translated: It shows this world.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'jig rten stong ngo zhes bya bar shes par mdzad do //
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'jig rten stong ngo zhes bya bar shes par mdzad do //
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom causes the world to be known as empty.

original: ji ltar na 'jig rten stong zhes bya bar shes par mdzad ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'jig rten stong zhes bya bar shes par mdzad ce na /
translated: How does it cause the world to be known as empty?

original: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel par @227b 'byung ba dang / dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang /
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel par @227b 'byung ba dang / dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang /
translated: the aggregates, the elements, the sense bases, dependent origination, the ten virtuous actions, the four concentrations, the four immeasurables, the four formless absorptions,

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba sngon du 'gro ba can lta bas byas pa drug cu rtsa gnyis dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / stobs bcu dang /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba sngon du 'gro ba can lta bas byas pa drug cu rtsa gnyis dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / stobs bcu dang /
translated: the sixty-two views that are preceded by the view of the transitory collection, the six perfections, the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, all the emptinesses, the ten powers,🔽the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, up to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad rnams dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi 'jig rten stong ngo zhes bya bar shes par mdzad do //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad rnams dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi 'jig rten stong ngo zhes bya bar shes par mdzad do //
translated: “The world is empty” is what they cause them to understand.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: In this way, Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom is the producer of the Tathāgata.

original: 'jig rten ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten ston par byed pa'o //
translated: It shows the world.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa la 'jig rten stong ngo zhes bya bar ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa la 'jig rten stong ngo zhes bya bar ston par mdzad do //
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom shows the Tathāgata that the world is empty.

original: ji ltar 'jig rten stong ngo zhes bya bar ston par mdzad ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'jig rten stong ngo zhes bya bar ston par mdzad ce na /
translated: How does it show that the world is empty?

original: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba sngon du 'gro ba can lta bas byas pa drug cu rtsa gnyis dang /
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba sngon du 'gro ba can lta bas byas pa drug cu rtsa gnyis dang /
translated: It shows the aggregates, elements, sense-spheres, dependent origination, the ten virtuous actions, the four concentrations, the four immeasurables, the four formless absorptions, the sixty-two views preceded by the view of the transitory collection,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad rnams dang /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad rnams dang /
translated: the six perfections, the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, all the emptinesses, the ten powers, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi 'jig rten stong ngo zhes bya bar ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi 'jig rten stong ngo zhes bya bar ston par mdzad do //
translated: up to the knowledge of all aspects—the world is empty.”

original: rab 'byor de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: Subhūti, thus the perfection of wisdom is the producer of the tathāgatas.

original: 'jig rten 'di ston par mdzad pa'o zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi rnam par brjod par mdzad pa dang / shes par mdzad pa dang / ston par mdzad pa shes pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di ston par mdzad pa'o zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi rnam par brjod par mdzad pa dang / shes par mdzad pa dang / ston par mdzad pa shes pa yin no //
translated: It is the one who shows this world.” This is the knowledge of the expression of emptiness, the knowledge of the teaching, and the knowledge of the showing.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa la 'jig rten bsam gyis mi khyab ces bya bar ston te /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa la 'jig rten bsam gyis mi khyab ces bya bar ston te /
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom teaches the Tathāgata that the world is inconceivable.

original: ji ltar 'jig rten bsam gyis mi khyab ces bya bar ston zhe na /🔽phung po lnga dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar @228a * //
analyzed: ji ltar 'jig rten bsam gyis mi khyab ces bya bar ston zhe na / phung po lnga dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar @228a * //
translated: How does it teach that the world is inconceivable?

original: 'byung ba dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi 'jig rten bsam gyis mi khyab ces bya bar ston to //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi 'jig rten bsam gyis mi khyab ces bya bar ston to //
translated: It teaches that the world of the five aggregates, elements, sense fields, dependent origination, up to the knowledge of all aspects is inconceivable.

original: de bzhin du rnam par dben zhes bya ba dang / shin tu stong zhes bya ba dang / rang bzhin stong zhes bya bar ston to //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par dben zhes bya ba dang / shin tu stong zhes bya ba dang / rang bzhin stong zhes bya bar ston to //
translated: Similarly, it teaches that it is void, utterly empty, and empty of intrinsic nature.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa la 'jig rten zhi zhes bya bar ston to //
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa la 'jig rten zhi zhes bya bar ston to //
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, this profound perfection of wisdom teaches the Tathāgata that the world is peaceful.

original: phung po lnga'i 'jig rten zhi zhes bya bar ston to //
analyzed: phung po lnga'i 'jig rten zhi zhes bya bar ston to //
translated: It teaches that the world of the five aggregates is peaceful.

original: de bzhin du khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi 'jig rten zhi zhes bya bar ston to //
analyzed: de bzhin du khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi 'jig rten zhi zhes bya bar ston to //
translated: In the same way, it shows the world of the elements, the world of the sense-fields, the world of dependent origination, up to the world of the knowledge of all modes, as peaceful.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: Thus, Subhuti, the perfection of wisdom is the producer of the Tathagata.🔽It shows this world.

original: 'jig rten 'di ston par byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang zhi ba nyid shes pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di ston par byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang zhi ba nyid shes pa yin no //
translated: This shows the knowledge of the inconceivable and the peaceful.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa la 'jig rten stong pa nyid ces bya bar ston te /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa la 'jig rten stong pa nyid ces bya bar ston te /
translated: Furthermore, Subhuti, the perfection of wisdom shows the Tathagata the world as empty.

original: phung po lnga'i 'jig rten stong pa nyid ces bya bar ston to //
analyzed: phung po lnga'i 'jig rten stong pa nyid ces bya bar ston to //
translated: It shows the world of the five skandhas as empty.

original: de bzhin du khams dang / skye mched kyi 'jig rten stong pa nyid ces bya bar ston to //
analyzed: de bzhin du khams dang / skye mched kyi 'jig rten stong pa nyid ces bya bar ston to //
translated: In the same way, it shows the world of the elements and the world of the sense-fields as empty.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag gi 'jig rten stong pa nyid ces bya bar ston to ;
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag gi 'jig rten stong pa nyid ces bya bar ston to ;
translated: and the world of the members of dependent origination is shown to be emptiness.

original: / de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi 'jig rten stong pa nyid ces bya bar ston to //
analyzed: / de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi 'jig rten stong pa nyid ces bya bar ston to //
translated: In the same way, the world of the knowledge of all modes is shown to be emptiness.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de bzhin gshegs pa skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de bzhin gshegs pa skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: Thus, Subhuti, the perfection of wisdom is the producer of the Tathagatas.

original: 'jig rten 'di ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di ston par byed pa'o //
translated: It shows this world.

original: rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di yang de bzhin gshegs pa la 'jig rten 'di'i 'du shes dang / 'jig rten pha rol gyi 'du shes su yang mi 'gyur ba de ltar 'jig rten ston to //
analyzed: rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di yang de bzhin gshegs pa la 'jig rten 'di'i 'du shes dang / 'jig rten pha rol gyi 'du shes su yang mi 'gyur ba de ltar 'jig rten ston to //
translated: And, Subhuti, this deep perfection of wisdom shows this world as the Tathagata does, without making any concept of this world or of the world beyond.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: de ni 'di ltar gang gis 'jig rten 'di'i 'du shes dang / 'jig rten pha rol gyi 'du shes su 'gyur ba'i chos de lta bu med do zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten 'du shes 'gog pa shes pa yin te shes pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar gang gis 'jig rten 'di'i 'du shes dang / 'jig rten pha rol gyi 'du shes su 'gyur ba'i chos de lta bu med do zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten 'du shes 'gog pa shes pa yin te shes pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: “This is the knowledge of the cessation of the perception of the world: there is no dharma by which there would be the perception of this world or the perception of the other world.”

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni bya ba chen pos nye bar gnas so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni bya ba chen pos nye bar gnas so //
translated: “Lord, this perfection of wisdom stands with a great deed.

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i bya bas dang / mnyam pa ma mchis pa'i bya bas dang / @228b gzhal du ma mchis pa'i bya bas dang / grangs ma mchis pa'i bya bas dang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i bya bas dang / mnyam pa ma mchis pa'i bya bas dang / @228b gzhal du ma mchis pa'i bya bas dang / grangs ma mchis pa'i bya bas dang /
translated: Lord, this perfection of wisdom stands with an inconceivable deed, an unequaled deed, an immeasurable deed, an incalculable deed,

original: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i bya bas nye bar gnas so //
analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i bya bas nye bar gnas so //
translated: and a deed that is equal to the unequaled.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor de de bzhin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor de de bzhin no //
translated: The Lord said,

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: “So it is, Subhūti, so it is.🔽It is just as you have said.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la bya ba chen pos nye bar gnas so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la bya ba chen pos nye bar gnas so //
translated: This perfection of wisdom of the Tathagatas stands for the performance of the great deed.

original: rab 'byor ji ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bya ba chen pos nye bar gnas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor ji ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bya ba chen pos nye bar gnas pa yin zhe na /
translated: Subhuti : How does the perfection of wisdom stand for the performance of the great deed?

original: 'di ltar sems can thams cad kyi skyabs dang gnas dang yongs su mi gtong ba'i don gyis so //
analyzed: 'di ltar sems can thams cad kyi skyabs dang gnas dang yongs su mi gtong ba'i don gyis so //
translated: The Lord : Because it is the refuge, the resort, the final relief of all beings.

original: rab 'byor ji ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i bya bas nye bar gnas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor ji ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i bya bas nye bar gnas pa yin zhe na /
translated: Subhuti : How does the perfection of wisdom stand for the performance of the inconceivable deed?

original: rab 'byor sangs rgyas nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa nyid dang / rang byung nyid dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor sangs rgyas nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa nyid dang / rang byung nyid dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa ste /
translated: The Lord : The Buddhahood, the Tathagatahood, the Self-Existent's state, the Omniscience is inconceivable.

original: rab 'byor rnam grangs des na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams la bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i bya bas nye bar gnas so //
analyzed: rab 'byor rnam grangs des na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams la bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i bya bas nye bar gnas so //
translated: “For this reason, Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom stands by the Tathāgatas, the Saints, the genuinely and fully awake Buddhas, with an inconceivable service.

original: rab 'byor ji ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di mi mnyam pa'i bya bas nye bar gnas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor ji ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di mi mnyam pa'i bya bas nye bar gnas pa yin zhe na /
translated: “Subhūti, how does this perfection of wisdom stand by the Tathāgatas, the Saints, the genuinely and fully awake Buddhas, with an unequalled service?

original: rab 'byor sems can gyi ris na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang rim grong bya ba mnyam pa'i sems can ni 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: rab 'byor sems can gyi ris na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang rim grong bya ba mnyam pa'i sems can ni 'ga' yang med do //
translated: Subhūti, there are no sentient beings in the class of sentient beings who are equal to the Tathāgatas, the Saints, the genuinely and fully awake Buddhas in terms of service.

original: rab 'byor rnam grangs des na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams la mnyam pa med pa'i bya bas nye bar gnas so //
analyzed: rab 'byor rnam grangs des na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams la mnyam pa med pa'i bya bas nye bar gnas so //
translated: “For this reason, Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom stands by the Tathāgatas, the Saints, the genuinely and fully awake Buddhas, with an unequalled service.”

original: rab 'byor ji ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams la gzhal du med pa'i bya bas nye bar gnas pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor ji ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams la gzhal du med pa'i bya bas nye bar gnas pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: “Subhūti, in what way is this perfection of wisdom present for the tathāgatas, worthy ones, perfectly complete buddhas with an incalculable activity?”

original: rab 'byor sangs rgyas nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa nyid dang / rang byung nyid dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni sus kyang tshad bya bar mi nus pas gzhal du med pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor sangs rgyas nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa nyid dang / rang byung nyid dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni sus kyang tshad bya bar mi nus pas gzhal du med pa ste /
translated: “Subhūti, buddhahood, tathāgatahood, self-arising, and omniscience cannot be measured by anyone, and so are incalculable.

original: rab 'byor rnam grangs des na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la gzhal du med pa'i bya bas nye bar gnas so //
analyzed: rab 'byor rnam grangs des na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la gzhal du med pa'i bya bas nye bar gnas so //
translated: Subhūti, by this one of many explanations this perfection of wisdom is present for the tathāgatas with an incalculable activity.”

original: rab 'byor ji ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams la grangs med pa'i @229a * //🔽bya bas nye bar gnas she na /
analyzed: rab 'byor ji ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams la grangs med pa'i @229a * //🔽bya bas nye bar gnas she na /
translated: “Subhūti, in what way is this perfection of wisdom present for the tathāgatas, worthy ones, perfectly complete buddhas with an immeasurable activity?”🔽“Subhūti, in what way is this perfection of wisdom present for the tathāgatas, worthy ones, perfectly complete buddhas with an innumerable activity?”

original: rab 'byor sangs rgyas nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa nyid dang / rang byung nyid dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni sus kyang bgrang bar mi nus pas grangs med pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor sangs rgyas nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa nyid dang / rang byung nyid dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni sus kyang bgrang bar mi nus pas grangs med pa ste /
translated: Subhūti, buddhahood, the state of a tathāgata, self-arising, and omniscience are beyond number, since no one can count them.

original: rab 'byor rnam grangs des na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la grangs med pa'i bya bas nye bar gnas so //
analyzed: rab 'byor rnam grangs des na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la grangs med pa'i bya bas nye bar gnas so //
translated: Subhūti, for this reason, the perfection of wisdom is present for the tathāgatas through a function that is beyond number.

original: rab 'byor ji ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i bya bas nye bar gnas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor ji ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i bya bas nye bar gnas pa yin zhe na /
translated: “Subhūti, how is the perfection of wisdom present through a function that is equal to the unequaled?

original: rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang / mnyam pa yang med na lhag pa lta ci smos te /
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang / mnyam pa yang med na lhag pa lta ci smos te /
translated: Subhūti, the tathāgatas are unequaled, let alone superior.

original: rab 'byor rnam grangs des na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i bya bas nye bar gnas so //
analyzed: rab 'byor rnam grangs des na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i bya bas nye bar gnas so //
translated: Subhūti, for this reason, the perfection of wisdom is present for the tathāgatas through a function that is equal to the unequaled.🔽Subhūti then said,

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhuti said:🔽🔽

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci yang sangs rgyas nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa nyid dang / rang byung nyid dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / mnyam pa ma mchis pa dang / gzhal du ma mchis pa dang / grangs ma mchis pa dang /

analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa lags sam /

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: rab 'byor de de bzhin no //

analyzed: de de bzhin te / rab 'byor sangs rgyas nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa nyid dang / rang byung nyid dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
translated: It is just as you have said!🔽Subhūti, buddhahood, thusness, self-arising, and omniscience are inconceivable.

original: rab 'byor sangs rgyas nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa nyid dang / rang byung nyid dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni mi mnyam pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'o //

translated: Subhūti, buddhahood, thusness, self-arising, and omniscience are incomparable, immeasurable, uncountable, and equal to the unequaled.”

original: rab 'byor gzugs kyang bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang gzhal du med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'o //🔽rab 'byor tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnams par shes pa yang bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor gzugs kyang bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang gzhal du med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'o // rab 'byor tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnams par shes pa yang bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'o //
translated: Subhūti, form is also inconceivable, incomparable, immeasurable, uncountable, and equal to the unequaled.🔽Subhūti, feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are also inconceivable, incomparable, immeasurable, uncountable, and equal to the unequaled.

original: khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rnams kyang bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / gangs med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rnams kyang bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / gangs med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'o //
translated: The constituents, the sense fields, and dependent origination are also inconceivable, incomparable, immeasurable, uncountable, and equal to the unequaled.

original: de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa @229b nyid kyi bar yang bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa @229b nyid kyi bar yang bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'o //
translated: In the same way, up to and including the knowledge of all aspects, are inconceivable, incomparable, immeasurable, innumerable, and equal to the unequaled.

original: rab 'byor chos thams cad kyang bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'o ;
analyzed: rab 'byor chos thams cad kyang bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'o ;
translated: Subhūti, all dharmas are also inconceivable, incomparable, immeasurable, innumerable, and equal to the unequaled.

original: / rab 'byor chos thams cad kyi chos nyid gang yin pa de la ni sems sam sems las byung ba rnams kyang dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / rab 'byor chos thams cad kyi chos nyid gang yin pa de la ni sems sam sems las byung ba rnams kyang dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Subhūti, in the true nature of all dharmas, mind or mental factors are not apprehended.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor gzugs bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa shes su med pa'i phyir ro //

translated: Subhūti, it is because form is not known to be inconceivable, incomparable, immeasurable, innumerable, and equal to the unequaled.

original: rab 'byor tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa shes su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab 'byor tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa shes su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Subhūti, it is because feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are inconceivable, incomparable, immeasurable, uncountable, and equal to the unequaled.

original: de bzhin du khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa shes su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa shes su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Similarly, it is because the constituents, the sense fields, and dependent origination are inconceivable, incomparable, immeasurable, uncountable, and equal to the unequaled.

original: rab 'byor rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa shes su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab 'byor rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa shes su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Subhūti, it is because up to omniscience is inconceivable, incomparable, immeasurable, uncountable, and equal to the unequaled.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du gzugs bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang / gzhal du ma mchis pa dang / grangs ma mchis pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa shes su ma mchis pa lags /🔽tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang / gzhal du ma mchis pa dang / grangs ma mchis pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa shes su ma mchis pa lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du gzugs bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang / gzhal du ma mchis pa dang / grangs ma mchis pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa shes su ma mchis pa lags / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang / gzhal du ma mchis pa dang / grangs ma mchis pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa shes su ma mchis pa lags /
translated: Blessed One, why is form inconceivable, incomparable, immeasurable, uncountable, and equal to the unequaled?🔽Why are feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness inconceivable, incomparable, immeasurable, uncountable, and equal to the unequaled?

original: de bzhin du khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rnams bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang / gzhal du ma mchis pa dang / grangs ma mchis pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa shes su ma mchis pa lags /
analyzed: de bzhin du khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rnams bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang / gzhal du ma mchis pa dang / grangs ma mchis pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa shes su ma mchis pa lags /
translated: Similarly, why are the elements, sense sources, and dependent origination inconceivable, incomparable, immeasurable, uncountable, and equal to the unequaled?

original: de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / @230a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / @230a * //
translated: Similarly, up to the knowledge of all aspects, it is inconceivable,

original: mi mnyam pa dang / gzhal du ma mchis pa dang / grangs ma mchis pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa shes su ma mchis pa lags /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang / gzhal du ma mchis pa dang / grangs ma mchis pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa shes su ma mchis pa lags /
translated: unequalled, immeasurable, innumerable, and equal to the unequaled.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: rab 'byor gzugs la yang bsam pa dang / mnyam pa dang / tshad dang / grangs dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa shes su med do //
analyzed: rab 'byor gzugs la yang bsam pa dang / mnyam pa dang / tshad dang / grangs dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa shes su med do //
translated: Subhūti, in form there is no conception, no equality, no measure, no number, and no equality with the unequaled.

original: de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen po nyid kyi bar la yang bsam pa dang / mnyam pa dang / tshad dang / grangs dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa shes su med do //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen po nyid kyi bar la yang bsam pa dang / mnyam pa dang / tshad dang / grangs dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa shes su med do //
translated: Similarly, up to the knowledge of all aspects, there is no conception, no equality, no measure, no number, and no equality with the unequaled.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said:

original: bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du gzugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi bsam pa dang / mnyam pa dang / tshad dang / grangs dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa shes su ma mchis pa lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du gzugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi bsam pa dang / mnyam pa dang / tshad dang / grangs dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa shes su ma mchis pa lags /
translated: “Lord, why is the thought, the sameness, the measure, the number, and the sameness as the unequalled of form up to omniscience not apprehended?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / mnyam pa med pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / mnyam pa med pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa ste /
translated: “Subhūti, the intrinsic nature of form is inconceivable, incomparable, immeasurable, uncountable, and equal to the unequaled.

original: rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is without an intrinsic nature.

original: rab 'byor tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / mnyam pa med pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / mnyam pa med pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa ste /
translated: Subhūti, the intrinsic nature of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness is inconceivable, incomparable, immeasurable, uncountable, and equal to the unequaled.

original: rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is without an intrinsic nature.

original: de bzhin du khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa ste /
translated: Similarly, the essential nature of the constituents, the sense fields, and dependent origination is inconceivable, incomparable, immeasurable, uncountable, and equal to the unequaled.

original: rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are essenceless.

original: de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi ngo bo nyid ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi ngo bo nyid ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa ste /
translated: Similarly, the essential nature of , up to and including omniscience, is inconceivable, incomparable, immeasurable, uncountable, and equal to the unequaled.

original: rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are essenceless.

original: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
translated: “Subhūti, what do you think?

original: gzugs gang bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa de la gzugs dmigs su yod dam /
analyzed: gzugs gang bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa de la gzugs dmigs su yod dam /
translated: Is the form that is inconceivable, incomparable, immeasurable, uncountable, and equal to the unequaled observable as form?

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa gang bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / @230b mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa med pa de la tshor ba dang /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa gang bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / @230b mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa med pa de la tshor ba dang /
translated: Is feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness, which are inconceivable, incomparable, immeasurable, uncountable, and equal to the unequaled, apprehensible?

original: 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa dmigs su yod dam /
analyzed: 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa dmigs su yod dam /
translated: Is feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness apprehensible?

original: khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba gang bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa de la rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dmigs su yod dam /
analyzed: khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba gang bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa de la rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dmigs su yod dam /
translated: Is the constituent, the sense field, and dependent origination, which are inconceivable, incomparable, immeasurable, uncountable, and equal to the unequaled, apprehensible?🔽Is the constituent, the sense field, and dependent origination apprehensible?”

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du gang bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa de la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dmigs su yod dam /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du gang bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa de la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dmigs su yod dam /
translated: up to and including the knowledge of all aspects, is inconceivable, incomparable, immeasurable, uncountable, and equal to the unequaled, is the knowledge of all aspects found there?

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti replied,

original: bcom ldan 'das ma mchis so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma mchis so //
translated: “No, Lord.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor rnam grangs des na chos thams cad bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor rnam grangs des na chos thams cad bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'o //
translated: “Subhūti, by this one of many explanations all phenomena are inconceivable, incomparable, immeasurable, uncountable, and equal to the unequaled.

original: rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos 'di dag ni bsam pa dang bral ba'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //🔽mnyam pa dang bral ba'i phyir mi mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos 'di dag ni bsam pa dang bral ba'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o // mnyam pa dang bral ba'i phyir mi mnyam pa'o //
translated: Subhūti, these dharmas of the Tathāgata are inconceivable because they are free from thought.🔽They are incomparable because they are free from equality.

original: tshad dang bral ba'i phyir gzhal du med pa'o //
analyzed: tshad dang bral ba'i phyir gzhal du med pa'o //
translated: They are immeasurable because they are free from measure.

original: bgrang ba dang bral ba'i phyir grangs med pa'o //
analyzed: bgrang ba dang bral ba'i phyir grangs med pa'o //
translated: It is immeasurable because it is beyond measure.

original: mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa dang bral ba'i phyir mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa ste /
analyzed: mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa dang bral ba'i phyir mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa ste /
translated: It is equal to the unequaled because it is beyond the equal and the unequal.🔽Subhūti, for these reasons all dharmas are inconceivable,

original: rab 'byor rnam grangs des na chos thams cad bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor rnam grangs des na chos thams cad bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'o //
translated: unequal, immeasurable, innumerable, and equal to the unequaled.

original: rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos de dag ni bsam pa las yongs su 'das pas na bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o ;
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos de dag ni bsam pa las yongs su 'das pas na bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o ;
translated: Subhūti, those dharmas of the Tathāgata are inconceivable because they transcend thought.

original: / mnyam pa las yongs su 'das pas na mi mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: / mnyam pa las yongs su 'das pas na mi mnyam pa'o //
translated: They are unequal because they transcend equality.

original: tshad ma las yongs su 'das pas na gzhal du med pa'o //
analyzed: tshad ma las yongs su 'das pas na gzhal du med pa'o //
translated: They are immeasurable because they transcend measure.

original: bgrang ba las yongs su 'das pas na grangs med pa'o //
analyzed: bgrang ba las yongs su 'das pas na grangs med pa'o //
translated: They are innumerable because they transcend number.

original: mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa las yongs su 'das pas na mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa las yongs su 'das pas na mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'o //
translated: They are equal to the unequaled because they transcend the equal and the unequal.

original: rab 'byor bsam gyis mi khyab ces bya ba ni bsam du med pa'i tshig bla dgas so //
analyzed: rab 'byor bsam gyis mi khyab ces bya ba ni bsam du med pa'i tshig bla dgas so //
translated: Subhūti, “inconceivable” is a synonym for “incapable of being conceived.”

original: rab 'byor mi mnyam pa zhes bya ba ni dpag tu mi rung ba'i tshig bla dgas so //🔽rab 'byor gzhal du med pa zhes bya ba ni tshad med pa'i tshig bla dgas so //
analyzed: rab 'byor mi mnyam pa zhes bya ba ni dpag tu mi rung ba'i tshig bla dgas so // rab 'byor gzhal du med pa zhes bya ba ni tshad med pa'i tshig bla dgas so //
translated: Subhūti, “unequalled” is a synonym for “incalculable.”🔽Subhūti, “immeasurable” is a synonym for “boundless.”

original: rab 'byor grangs med pa zhes bya ba ni bgrang du med pa'i tshig bla dgas so //🔽rang @231a * //
analyzed: rab 'byor grangs med pa zhes bya ba ni bgrang du med pa'i tshig bla dgas so // rang @231a * //
translated: Subhūti, “innumerable” is a synonym for “incapable of being counted.”

original: 'byor mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bya ba ni mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa med pa'i tshig bla dgas te /
analyzed: 'byor mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bya ba ni mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa med pa'i tshig bla dgas te /
translated: Subhūti, “equal to the unequaled” is a synonym for “without equal and without unequal.”

original: rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos 'di dag ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos 'di dag ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'o //
translated: Subhūti, these dharmas of the Tathāgata are inconceivable, unequalled, immeasurable, innumerable, and equal to the unequaled.

original: rab 'byor bsam gyis mi khyab ces bya ba ni nam mkha' bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab 'byor bsam gyis mi khyab ces bya ba ni nam mkha' bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Subhūti, “inconceivable” is because space is inconceivable.

original: de bzhin du mi mnyam pa zhes bya ba dang / gzhal du med ces bya ba dang / grangs med ces bya ba dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de bzhin du mi mnyam pa zhes bya ba dang / gzhal du med ces bya ba dang / grangs med ces bya ba dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i phyir te /
translated: In the same way, it is said to be ‘unequal,’ ‘incalculable,’ ‘uncountable,’ and ‘equal to the unequaled’ because space is equal to the unequaled.🔽Subhūti, these dharmas of the Tathāgata are inconceivable, unequal, incalculable, uncountable, and equal to the unequaled.

original: rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos de dag ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa ste /🔽de dag ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang / lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi bsam pa'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos de dag ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa ste / de dag ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang / lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi bsam pa'am /
translated: They cannot be conceived,

original: mnyam par ram /
analyzed: mnyam par ram /
translated: equaled,

original: tshad mar ram /🔽grangs su'am mnyam pa dang / mi mnyam par bya bar mi nus te /
analyzed: tshad mar ram / grangs su'am mnyam pa dang / mi mnyam par bya bar mi nus te /
translated: measured,🔽counted, or compared to the unequaled by all the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas and the world with its gods, humans, and asuras.

original: de ltar na sangs rgyas gzhal du med do //
analyzed: de ltar na sangs rgyas gzhal du med do //
translated: In that way, the buddhas are incalculable.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams gzhal du med do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams gzhal du med do //
translated: The buddhadharmas are incalculable.

original: de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / grangs med pa dang mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i le'u 'di bstan pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / grangs med pa dang mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i le'u 'di bstan pa'i tshe /
translated: When the Blessed One had taught this chapter on the inconceivable, the incomparable, the immeasurable, the unaccountable, the countless, and the equal to the unequaled,

original: dge slong lnga brgya nye bar len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol lo //
analyzed: dge slong lnga brgya nye bar len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol lo //
translated: five hundred monks were liberated from defilements without further appropriation.

original: dge slong ma brgya phrag nyi shu nye bar len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol lo //
analyzed: dge slong ma brgya phrag nyi shu nye bar len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol lo //
translated: Two hundred nuns were liberated from defilements without further appropriation.

original: dge bsnyen stong phrag drug cu dang / dge bsnyen ma stong phrag nyi shu ni chos rnams la rdul dang bral zhing dri ma dang bral ba'i chos kyi mig rnam par dag go //
analyzed: dge bsnyen stong phrag drug cu dang / dge bsnyen ma stong phrag nyi shu ni chos rnams la rdul dang bral zhing dri ma dang bral ba'i chos kyi mig rnam par dag go //
translated: Sixty thousand male and twenty thousand female lay followers purified the stainless and immaculate Dharma eye regarding phenomena.

original: byang chub sems dpa' stong phrag nyi shus ni mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob par gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' stong phrag nyi shus ni mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob par gyur te /
translated: Twenty thousand bodhisattvas attained acceptance that phenomena are not produced.

original: de dag bcom ldan 'das kyis bskal pa bzang po 'di la sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro zhes lung bstan to zhes bya ba ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi skad cig ma bzhi yin no //
analyzed: de dag bcom ldan 'das kyis bskal pa bzang po 'di la sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro zhes lung bstan to zhes bya ba ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi skad cig ma bzhi yin no //
translated: This is the fourth moment of suffering, beginning with the inconceivable.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Subhuti said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni zab ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni zab ste /
translated: This perfection of wisdom, O Lord, is profound.

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni bya ba chen pos nye bar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni bya ba chen pos nye bar gnas pa'o //
translated: This perfection of wisdom, O Lord, stands near for the great work.

original: @231b bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni bya ba tshad ma mchis pa dang / bya ba mi mnyam pa dang / bya ba gzhal du ma mchis pa dang / bya ba grangs med pa dang / bya ba mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i slad du nye bar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: @231b bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni bya ba tshad ma mchis pa dang / bya ba mi mnyam pa dang / bya ba gzhal du ma mchis pa dang / bya ba grangs med pa dang / bya ba mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i slad du nye bar gnas pa'o //
translated: This perfection of wisdom, O Lord, stands near for the immeasurable work, for the incomparable, the incalculable, the unequaled work.

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor de de bzhin no //🔽de de bzhin te /🔽rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni bya ba chen pos nye bar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor de de bzhin no // de de bzhin te / rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni bya ba chen pos nye bar gnas pa'o //
translated: The Blessed One replied to the venerable Subhūti:🔽“Subhūti, it is so!🔽It is just as you have said!🔽Subhūti, this perfection of wisdom is present with a great deed.

original: rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni bya ba tshad med pa dang / bya ba mi mnyam pa dang / bya ba gzhal du med pa dang / bya ba grangs med pa dang / bya ba mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pas nye bar gnas pa'o //🔽de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ni pha rol tu phyin pa lnga dang yang dag par ldan pa'o //🔽rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni nang stong pa nyid dang yang dag par ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni bya ba tshad med pa dang / bya ba mi mnyam pa dang / bya ba gzhal du med pa dang / bya ba grangs med pa dang / bya ba mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pas nye bar gnas pa'o //🔽de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ni pha rol tu phyin pa lnga dang yang dag par ldan pa'o //🔽rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni nang stong pa nyid dang yang dag par ldan pa'o //
translated: The Lord having said that, the venerable Subhūti said to him, “Lord, it is amazing how much the perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva great beings has been exalted by the Tathāgata, how
