translated: It is because this perfection of generosity is far away.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni ring du song ba'i phyir ro //🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni ring du song ba'i phyir ro // 'di lta ste /
translated: It is because this perfection of morality is far away.

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni ring du song ba'i phyir ro //🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni ring du song ba'i phyir ro // 'di lta ste /
translated: It is because this perfection of patience is far away.

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni ring du song ba'i phyir ro //🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni ring du song ba'i phyir ro //🔽'di lta ste /
translated: It is because this perfection of perseverance is far away.🔽It is because this perfection of concentration is far away.🔽It is because this perfection of wisdom is far away.

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni ring du song ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni ring du song ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This perfection of concentration is far-reaching.

original: 'dis ji ltar rnam par brtags pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dis ji ltar rnam par brtags pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the conceptual thoughts that it analyzes do not exist in the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de ni 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni ring du song ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni ring du song ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This perfection of wisdom is far-reaching.

original: de lta yin yang byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu des tshu rol mi shes /
analyzed: de lta yin yang byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu des tshu rol mi shes /
translated: Even though that is the case, those sons of a good family in the vehicle of the bodhisattvas do not know the near side,

original: pha rol yang mi shes te /
analyzed: pha rol yang mi shes te /
translated: and they do not know the far side.

original: de sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su ma bzung /
analyzed: de sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su ma bzung /
translated: They are not held by the perfection of giving,

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su ma bzung /🔽bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su ma bzung /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su ma bzung / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su ma bzung /
translated: they are not held by the perfection of morality,🔽they are not held by the perfection of patience,

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su ma bzung /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su ma bzung /
translated: they are not held by the perfection of perseverance,

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su ma bzung /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su ma bzung /
translated: they are not held by the perfection of concentration,🔽and they are not held by the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su ma bzung /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su ma bzung /
translated: not embraced by the perfection of wisdom,

original: de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyis yongs su ma bzung bas nyan thos kyi sa'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyis yongs su ma bzung bas nyan thos kyi sa'am /
translated: and similarly, not embraced by up to the knowledge of all aspects, will fall to the śrāvaka level

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sar ltung ste /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sar ltung ste /
translated: or the pratyekabuddha level.

original: de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du mi 'byung ngo //
translated: They will not emerge into the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang thabs mkhas pas yongs su ma bzung na nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sar ltung ngo //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang thabs mkhas pas yongs su ma bzung na nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sar ltung ngo //
translated: Subhūti, in that way, when bodhisattva great beings are not embraced by the perfection of wisdom and skillful means, they fall to the śrāvaka level or the pratyekabuddha level.

original: rab 'byor ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang thabs mkhas pas yongs su bzung na /
analyzed: rab 'byor ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang thabs mkhas pas yongs su bzung na /
translated: “Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings are embraced by the perfection of wisdom and skillful means,

original: nyan thos kyi sa'am /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sa'am /
translated: how do they not fall to the śrāvaka level🔽or the pratyekabuddha level?

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sar mi ltung zhing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'grub par 'gyur ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sar mi ltung zhing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'grub par 'gyur ba yin zhe na /
translated: and not falling to the level of a pratyekabuddha, he will reach the perfection of unsurpassed, complete enlightenment.

original: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thog mar sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba na bdag dang bdag gir bya bar ma ltung ba'i sems kyis sbyin pa yongs su gtong ngo //
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thog mar sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba na bdag dang bdag gir bya bar ma ltung ba'i sems kyis sbyin pa yongs su gtong ngo //
translated: Subhūti, here a bodhisattva mahāsattva, when first giving a gift, gives the gift with a mind that does not fall into ‘I’ and ‘mine.’

original: bdag dang bdag gir bya bar ma ltung ba'i sems kyis tshul khrims srung ngo //🔽bdag dang @244a * //🔽bdag gir bya bar ma ltung ba'i sems kyis bzod pa sgom mo //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gir bya bar ma ltung ba'i sems kyis tshul khrims srung ngo // bdag dang @244a * // bdag gir bya bar ma ltung ba'i sems kyis bzod pa sgom mo //
translated: With a mind that does not fall into ‘I’ and ‘mine,’ he guards morality.🔽With a mind that does not fall into ‘I’ and ‘mine,’ he cultivates patience.

original: bdag dang bdag gir bya bar ma ltung ba'i sems kyis brtson 'grus rtsom mo //🔽bdag dang bdag gir bya bar ma ltung ba'i sems kyis bsam gtan sgom mo //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gir bya bar ma ltung ba'i sems kyis brtson 'grus rtsom mo // bdag dang bdag gir bya bar ma ltung ba'i sems kyis bsam gtan sgom mo //
translated: With a mind that does not fall into ‘I’ and ‘mine,’ he makes an effort.🔽With a mind that does not fall into ‘I’ and ‘mine,’ he meditates on concentration.

original: bdag dang bdag gir bya bar ma ltung ba'i sems kyis shes rab sgom ste /
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gir bya bar ma ltung ba'i sems kyis shes rab sgom ste /
translated: With a mind that does not fall into ‘I’ and ‘mine,’ he cultivates wisdom.

original: de 'di snyam du bdag ni sbyin pa yongs su gtong ngo //🔽sbyin pa ni 'di gtong ngo //
analyzed: de 'di snyam du bdag ni sbyin pa yongs su gtong ngo // sbyin pa ni 'di gtong ngo //
translated: He does not think, “I am practicing generosity.🔽I am giving this gift to this person.

original: 'di la sbyin pa gtong ngo zhes bya bar mi sems so //
analyzed: 'di la sbyin pa gtong ngo zhes bya bar mi sems so //
translated: I am giving this gift.”🔽He does not think, “I am protecting morality.

original: bdag ni tshul khrims srung ngo //🔽tshul khrims ni 'di srung ngo //
analyzed: bdag ni tshul khrims srung ngo // tshul khrims ni 'di srung ngo //
translated: I am protecting this morality.

original: 'di dag la tshul khrims srung ngo //🔽bdag ni bzod pa sgom mo //
analyzed: 'di dag la tshul khrims srung ngo // bdag ni bzod pa sgom mo //
translated: I am protecting morality for these beings.”🔽He does not think, “I am cultivating patience.

original: bzod pa ni 'di sgom mo //
analyzed: bzod pa ni 'di sgom mo //
translated: I am cultivating this patience.

original: 'di dag la bzod pa sgom mo //
analyzed: 'di dag la bzod pa sgom mo //
translated: I am cultivating patience for these beings.”🔽He does not think, “I am making an effort at perseverance.

original: bdag ni brtson 'grus rtsom mo //🔽brtson 'grus ni 'di rtsom mo //
analyzed: bdag ni brtson 'grus rtsom mo // brtson 'grus ni 'di rtsom mo //
translated: I am making this effort at perseverance.

original: 'di dag la brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
analyzed: 'di dag la brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
translated: I am making an effort at perseverance for these beings.”

original: bdag ni bsam gtan rnams la snyoms par 'jug go //🔽bsam gtan ni 'di dag la snyoms par 'jug go //
analyzed: bdag ni bsam gtan rnams la snyoms par 'jug go // bsam gtan ni 'di dag la snyoms par 'jug go //
translated: He does not think, “I am cultivating meditative stability.🔽I am cultivating this meditative stability.

original: 'di rnams la bsam gtan la snyoms par 'jug go //🔽bdag ni shes rab sgom mo //
analyzed: 'di rnams la bsam gtan la snyoms par 'jug go // bdag ni shes rab sgom mo //
translated: I am cultivating meditative stability for these beings.”🔽He does not think, “I am cultivating wisdom.🔽I am cultivating this wisdom.

original: shes rab ni 'di sgom mo //
analyzed: shes rab ni 'di sgom mo //
translated: I am cultivating wisdom for these beings.”

original: 'di'i don du shes rab sgom mo zhes bya bar mi sems te sbyin pa rlom sems su mi byed /
analyzed: 'di'i don du shes rab sgom mo zhes bya bar mi sems te sbyin pa rlom sems su mi byed /
translated: He does not falsely project generosity,

original: sbyin pas rlom sems su mi byed /
analyzed: sbyin pas rlom sems su mi byed /
translated: They do not become proud because of generosity.

original: bdag ni sbyin pa byed pa zhes bya bar rlom sems su mi byed ;🔽tshul khrims rlom sems su mi byed /
analyzed: bdag ni sbyin pa byed pa zhes bya bar rlom sems su mi byed ; tshul khrims rlom sems su mi byed /
translated: They do not become proud, thinking, ‘I am generous.’🔽They do not become proud because of discipline.

original: tshul khrims kyis rlom sems su mi byed /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyis rlom sems su mi byed /
translated: They do not become proud because of discipline.

original: bdag ni tshul khrims dang ldan pa'o zhes bya bar rlom sems su mi byed do //🔽bzod pa rlom sems su mi byed /
analyzed: bdag ni tshul khrims dang ldan pa'o zhes bya bar rlom sems su mi byed do // bzod pa rlom sems su mi byed /
translated: They do not become proud, thinking, ‘I am disciplined.’🔽They do not become proud because of patience.

original: bzod pas rlom sems su mi byed /
analyzed: bzod pas rlom sems su mi byed /
translated: They do not become proud because of patience.

original: bdag ni bzod pa dang ldan pa'o zhes rlom sems su mi byed do //🔽brtson 'grus rlom sems su mi byed /
analyzed: bdag ni bzod pa dang ldan pa'o zhes rlom sems su mi byed do // brtson 'grus rlom sems su mi byed /
translated: They do not become proud, thinking, ‘I am patient.’🔽They do not become proud because of diligence.

original: brtson 'grus kyis rlom sems su mi byed /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyis rlom sems su mi byed /
translated: They do not become proud because of diligence.

original: bdag ni brtson 'grus dang ldan pa'o zhes rlom sems su mi byed do //🔽bsam gtan rlom sems su mi byed /
analyzed: bdag ni brtson 'grus dang ldan pa'o zhes rlom sems su mi byed do // bsam gtan rlom sems su mi byed /
translated: They do not become proud, thinking, ‘I am diligent.’🔽They do not become proud because of concentration.

original: bsam gtan gyis rlom sems su mi byed /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyis rlom sems su mi byed /
translated: They do not become proud because of concentration.

original: bdag ni bsam gtan dang ldan pa'o zhes rlom sems su mi byed do //
analyzed: bdag ni bsam gtan dang ldan pa'o zhes rlom sems su mi byed do //
translated: They do not become proud, thinking, ‘I am concentrated.’

original: shes rab rlom sems su mi byed /
analyzed: shes rab rlom sems su mi byed /
translated: They do not become proud because of insight.

original: shes rab kyis rlom sems su mi byed /
analyzed: shes rab kyis rlom sems su mi byed /
translated: He does not become proud through wisdom.

original: bdag ni shes rab dang ldan pa'o zhes bya bar rlom sems su mi byed do //
analyzed: bdag ni shes rab dang ldan pa'o zhes bya bar rlom sems su mi byed do //
translated: He does not become proud, thinking, ‘I have wisdom.’

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: de ni 'di ltar gang gis rlom sems su byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa de dag ni sbyin pa'i pha rol @244b tu phyin pa la med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar gang gis rlom sems su byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa de dag ni sbyin pa'i pha rol @244b tu phyin pa la med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because those conceptual thoughts through which one might become proud are absent in the perfection of giving.

original: de bzhin du gang gis rlom sems su byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa de dag ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du gang gis rlom sems su byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa de dag ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Similarly, those conceptual thoughts through which one might become proud are absent in the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, and the perfection of concentration.

original: 'di ltar gang gis rlom sems su 'gyur ba'i rnam par rtog pa de dag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gis rlom sems su 'gyur ba'i rnam par rtog pa de dag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because those conceptual thoughts through which one might become proud are absent in the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni ring du song ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni ring du song ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the perfection of wisdom has gone far.

original: de ltar yin pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de yang tshu rol dang pha rol gyis kyang rlom sems su mi byed na /
analyzed: de ltar yin pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de yang tshu rol dang pha rol gyis kyang rlom sems su mi byed na /
translated: “Therefore, Subhūti, when a bodhisattva great being does not get ideas about this shore or the further shore,

original: de sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su bzung /
analyzed: de sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su bzung /
translated: then, having been taken hold of by the perfection of giving,

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su bzung ba dang ;🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyis yongs su bzung bas nyan thos kyi sa'am /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su bzung ba dang ; rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyis yongs su bzung bas nyan thos kyi sa'am /
translated: having been taken hold of by the perfection of morality, perfection of patience, perfection of perseverance, perfection of concentration, and perfection of wisdom,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sar mi ltung ste /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sar mi ltung ste /
translated: and having been taken hold of by up to the knowledge of all aspects, they do not fall to the śrāvaka level or the pratyekabuddha level,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang 'grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang 'grub par 'gyur /
translated: and they will also reach the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su bzung /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su bzung /
translated: In this way, Subhūti, the person in the Bodhisattva Vehicle who is held by the perfection of wisdom and

original: thabs mkhas pas yongs su bzung bas nyan thos kyi sa'am /
analyzed: thabs mkhas pas yongs su bzung bas nyan thos kyi sa'am /
translated: who is held by skillful means does not fall to the śrāvaka level or

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sar mi ltung gi de ltar thabs mkhas pas yongs su bzung bas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni yongs su bzung ba'i khyad par lam gyi skad cig ma gsum pa yin no
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sar mi ltung gi de ltar thabs mkhas pas yongs su bzung bas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni yongs su bzung ba'i khyad par lam gyi skad cig ma gsum pa yin no
translated: the pratyekabuddha level, and in this way, held by skillful means, they will accomplish unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.” This is the third moment of the path, the distinctive retention.

original: // de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: // de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Lord having said that, venerable Subhūti said to him,

original: bcom ldan 'das las dang po pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das las dang po pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi /
translated: “Blessed One, how should a beginning bodhisattva great being train in the perfection of wisdom?

original: ji ltar bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should they train in the perfection of concentration?

original: ji ltar brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should they train in the perfection of perseverance?

original: ji ltar bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should they train in the perfection of patience?

original: ji ltar tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should they train in the perfection of discipline?

original: ji ltar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi /🔽ji ltar sangs @245a * //
analyzed: ji ltar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi / ji ltar sangs @245a * //
translated: How should they train in the perfection of generosity?🔽How should they train in the Buddha-qualities?

original: rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i bar la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i bar la bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should they train in the distinct attributes of a Buddha?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor 'di la las dang po pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par 'dod pa dang / sbam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la las dang po pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par 'dod pa dang / sbam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: “Subhūti, here, beginner bodhisattva great beings who want to train in the perfection of wisdom, the perfection of concentration, the perfection of perseverance,

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par 'dod pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la bslab par 'dod pas dge ba'i bshes gnyen gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ba ston po /
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par 'dod pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la bslab par 'dod pas dge ba'i bshes gnyen gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ba ston po /
translated: “Those who wish to train in the perfection of wisdom, the perfection of meditative stabilization, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience, the perfection of morality, and the perfection of giving, up to those who wish to train in the knowledge of all aspects should rely on a spiritual friend who teaches the perfection of wisdom.

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ston pa de dag la brten par bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ston pa de dag la brten par bya'o //
translated: They should rely on those who teach the perfection of meditative stabilization, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience, the perfection of morality, and the perfection of giving.

original: bsnyen bskur bar bya'o //
analyzed: bsnyen bskur bar bya'o //
translated: They should serve them.

original: de dag la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ltar ston te /
analyzed: de dag la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ltar ston te /
translated: They should be taught this perfection of wisdom like this:

original: tshur rigs kyi bu sbyin pa gang dang gang sbyin pa de thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su sngos shig / tshur rigs kyi bu tshul khrims gang dang gang srung ba dang / bzod pa sgrub pa dang /
analyzed: tshur rigs kyi bu sbyin pa gang dang gang sbyin pa de thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su sngos shig / tshur rigs kyi bu tshul khrims gang dang gang srung ba dang / bzod pa sgrub pa dang /
translated: Come, son of noble family, whatever generosity you give, dedicate it all to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.🔽 Come, son of noble family, whatever morality you guard, whatever patience you accomplish,🔽whatever effort you undertake, whatever meditative stabilization you enter into, whatever wisdom you cultivate, dedicate it all to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: brtson 'grus rtsom pa dang / bsam gtan la snyoms bar 'jug pa dang / shes rab sgom pa de dag thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su sngos shig / rigs kyi bu khyod bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub gzugs kyi sgo nas tshol bar ma byed cig / tshor🔽ba las ma byed /🔽'du shes las ma byed /
analyzed: brtson 'grus rtsom pa dang / bsam gtan la snyoms bar 'jug pa dang / shes rab sgom pa de dag thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su sngos shig / rigs kyi bu khyod bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub gzugs kyi sgo nas tshol bar ma byed cig / tshor ba las ma byed / 'du shes las ma byed /
translated: Son of noble family, do not seek unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening through form.🔽Do not seek it through feeling.

original: 'du byed rnams las ma byed /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams las ma byed /
translated: Do not seek it through discrimination.🔽Do not seek it through compositional factors.

original: rnam par shes pa'i sgo nas tshol bar ma byed cig / rigs kyi bu khyod bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i sog nas tshul bar ma byed cig / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i sgo nas tshol bar ma byed cig / rigs kyi bu khyod bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i sog nas tshul bar ma byed cig / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang
translated: Do not seek it through the perfection of moral discipline,🔽the perfection of patience,🔽the perfection of perseverance,🔽the perfection of concentration, or the perfection of wisdom.🔽Do not seek it through inner emptiness,🔽do not seek it through outer emptiness,🔽do not seek it through inner and outer emptiness,

original: / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi sog nas tshol bar ma byed cig / nang stong pa nyid las ma byed cig / phyi stong pa nyid las ma byed cig / phyi nang stong pa nyid las ma byed cig / dngos po @245b med pa'i
analyzed: / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi sog nas tshol bar ma byed cig / nang stong pa nyid las ma byed cig / phyi stong pa nyid las ma byed cig / phyi nang stong pa nyid las ma byed cig / dngos po @245b med pa'i
translated: do not seek it through the emptiness of things,

original: ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar las ma byed cig / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams las ma byed cig / yang dag par spong ba rnams kyi sog nas tshol bar ma byed cig / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar las ma byed cig / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams las ma byed cig / yang dag par spong ba rnams kyi sog nas tshol bar ma byed cig / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang /
translated: Do not seek the legs of miraculous power, the faculties,🔽the powers, the branches of enlightenment, and the path.🔽Do not engage with the five higher perceptions, the immeasurables, the concentrations, and the formless absorptions. Do not engage with the noble truths.🔽Do not engage with the eight liberations.🔽Do not engage with the nine serial absorptions.

original: stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam rnams kyi sgo nas tshol bar ma byed cig / mngon par shes pa lnga dang / tshad med pa dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams las ma byed cig /'phags pa'i bden pa rnams las ma byed cig / rnam bar thar pa brgyad rnams las ma byed cig / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu rnams las ma byed cig / stong pa nyid
analyzed: stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam rnams kyi sgo nas tshol bar ma byed cig / mngon par shes pa lnga dang / tshad med pa dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams las ma byed cig /'phags pa'i bden pa rnams las ma byed cig / rnam bar thar pa brgyad rnams las ma byed cig / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu rnams las ma byed cig / stong pa nyid
translated: Do not engage with the emptiness gate of liberation.

original: dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa rnams kyi sgo nas tshol bar ma byed cig / ting nge 'dzin rnams las tshol bar ma byed cig / gzungs kyi sgo rnams las ma byed cig / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu rnams las ma byed cig / mi 'jigs pa bzhi rnams🔽las ma byed cig / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi rnams las ma byed cig / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad rnams kyi sgo nas tshol bar ma byed cig / rigs kyi bu khyod bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i
analyzed: dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa rnams kyi sgo nas tshol bar ma byed cig / ting nge 'dzin rnams las tshol bar ma byed cig / gzungs kyi sgo rnams las ma byed cig / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu rnams las ma byed cig / mi 'jigs pa bzhi rnams las ma byed cig / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi rnams las ma byed cig / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad rnams kyi sgo nas tshol bar ma byed cig / rigs kyi bu khyod bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i
translated: Do not seek it through the emptiness of internal phenomena, the emptiness of external phenomena, the emptiness of both external and internal phenomena, the emptiness of emptiness, the emptiness of great extent, the emptiness of ultimate reality, the emptiness of conditioned phenomena, the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, the emptiness of the unlimited, the emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end, the emptiness of non-dispersal, the emptiness of inherent existence, the emptiness of all things, the emptiness of intrinsic defining characteristics, the emptiness of non-apprehension, the emptiness of non-entities, or the emptiness of essential nature.🔽Do not seek it through the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four assurances, the four kinds of exact knowledge, the great love, the great compassion, the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas, or the thirty-two major marks of a great being.

original: byang chub rnam par thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi sog nas tshol bar ma byed cig / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub rnam par thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi sog nas tshol bar ma byed cig / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Son of noble family, do not seek it through the thirty-two major marks of a great being, the eighty minor marks, the ten powers, the four assurances, the four kinds of exact knowledge, the great love, the great compassion, the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas, or omniscience.🔽Why is that?

original: gzugs su mngon par zhen pa med pas ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs su mngon par zhen pa med pas ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is through not clinging to form that one attains unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: tsher ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams su mngon par zhen pa med pa dang / rnam par shes par mngon par zhen pa med pas ni bal na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tsher ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams su mngon par zhen pa med pa dang / rnam par shes par mngon par zhen pa med pas ni bal na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and the aggregates of feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mchog tu 'dzin pa med pa dang /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mchog tu 'dzin pa med pa dang /
translated: He does not grasp at the perfection of generosity, the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, or the perfection of concentration.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mchog tu 'dzin pa med pa dang / nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du mngon par zhen pa med pa dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams su mngon par zhen pa med pa dang /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mchog tu 'dzin pa med pa dang / nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du mngon par zhen pa med pa dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams su mngon par zhen pa med pa dang /
translated: He does not grasp at the perfection of wisdom, and he does not grasp at the emptiness of internal phenomena, up to and including the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities, and he does not grasp at the applications of mindfulness.

original: yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / @246a * //
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / @246a * //
translated: the right efforts,

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / lam rnams su mngon par zhen pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams su mngon par zhen pa med pa dang /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / lam rnams su mngon par zhen pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams su mngon par zhen pa med pa dang /
translated: the legs of manifestation, the faculties, the powers, the branches of awakening, and the path; he has no attachment to the superknowledges,

original: tshad med pa dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams su mngon par zhen pa med pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams su mngon par zhen pa med pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu rnams su mngon par zhen pa med pa dang /
analyzed: tshad med pa dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams su mngon par zhen pa med pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams su mngon par zhen pa med pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu rnams su mngon par zhen pa med pa dang /
translated: he has no attachment to the immeasurables, the concentrations, and the formless absorptions; he has no attachment to the noble truths, the eight deliverances, and the nine serial absorptions;

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa rnams su mngon par zhen pa med pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams su mngon par zhen pa med pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa rnams su mngon par zhen pa med pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams su mngon par zhen pa med pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang /
translated: and they are not fixated on emptiness, signlessness, and aspirationlessness, and they are not fixated on the dhāraṇī gateways and the meditative stabilization gateways, and they are not fixated on the ten powers of the tathāgatas,

original: mi 'jigs pa bzhi rnams su mngon par zhen pa med pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du mngon par zhen pa med pas ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa bzhi rnams su mngon par zhen pa med pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du mngon par zhen pa med pas ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and they are not fixated on the four fearlessnesses, and they are not fixated on the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and they are not fixated on the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, up to and they are not fixated on the knowledge of all aspects, they will attain unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”

original: rigs kyi bu khyod shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu khyod shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: “Son of a good family, when you practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: gzugs la 'dod pa ma bskyed cig / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs la 'dod pa ma bskyed cig / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: do not produce desire for form. And why?

original: rigs kyi bu 'dod pa med pa ni gzugs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'dod pa med pa ni gzugs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Son of a good family, because form is without desire.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la 'dod pa ma bskyed cig / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la 'dod pa ma bskyed cig / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Do not generate desire for feeling, for perception, for volitional factors, or for consciousness. And why?

original: rigs kyi bu 'dod pa med pa ni rnam par shes pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'dod pa med pa ni rnam par shes pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Son of a good family, consciousness is without desire.

original: rigs kyi bu khyod sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la 'dod pa ma bskyed cig / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu khyod sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la 'dod pa ma bskyed cig / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: Son of a good family, do not generate desire for the perfection of giving, for the perfection of good conduct, for the perfection of patience, for the perfection of perseverance, for the perfection of concentration,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la 'dod pa ma bskyed cig / nang stong pa nyid la 'dod pa ma bskyed cig / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la 'dod pa ma bskyed cig / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la 'dod pa ma bskyed cig / nang stong pa nyid la 'dod pa ma bskyed cig / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la 'dod pa ma bskyed cig / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa
translated: or for the perfection of wisdom. Do not generate desire for inner emptiness, up to do not generate desire for the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature. Do not generate desire for the applications of mindfulness,

original: rnams la 'dod pa ma bskyed cig / yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam rnams la 'dod @246b pa ma bskyed cig / tshad med pa dang /
analyzed: rnams la 'dod pa ma bskyed cig / yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam rnams la 'dod @246b pa ma bskyed cig / tshad med pa dang /
translated: Do not develop desire for the immeasurables,

original: bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams la 'dod pa ma bskyed cig / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu la 'dod pa ma bskyed cig / stong pa nyid dang ;
analyzed: bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams la 'dod pa ma bskyed cig / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu la 'dod pa ma bskyed cig / stong pa nyid dang ;
translated: the meditative stabilizations, the formless meditative absorptions, or the noble truths. Do not develop desire for the eight deliverances or the nine serial meditative absorptions. Do not develop desire for emptiness,

original: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams la 'dod pa ma bskyed cig / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams la 'dod pa ma bskyed cig / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang /
translated: signlessness, or wishlessness, or for the clairvoyances, the ten powers, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, or the distinct attributes of a buddha. Do not develop desire for all the meditative stabilizations,

original: gzungs kyi sgo rnams la 'dod pa ma bskyed cig / rigs kyi bu khyod rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la 'dod pa ma bskyed cig / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo rnams la 'dod pa ma bskyed cig / rigs kyi bu khyod rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la 'dod pa ma bskyed cig / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Noble sir, do not develop a desire for the knowledge of all aspects. And why?

original: rigs kyi bu 'dod pa med pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'dod pa med pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Noble sir, the knowledge of all aspects is without desire.

original: rigs kyi bu khyod rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la 'dod pa ma bskyed cig / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub la 'dod pa ma bskyed cig / byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la 'dod pa ma bskyed cig / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la 'dod pa ma bskyed cig / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu khyod rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la 'dod pa ma bskyed cig / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub la 'dod pa ma bskyed cig / byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la 'dod pa ma bskyed cig / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la 'dod pa ma bskyed cig / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Noble sir, do not develop a desire for the result of stream enterer, do not develop a desire for the result of once-returner, do not develop a desire for the result of non-returner, do not develop a desire for the state of a worthy one, do not develop a desire for a pratyekabuddha’s awakening, do not develop a desire for the secure state of a bodhisattva, and do not develop a desire for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening. And why?

original: rigs kyi bu chos thams cad ni ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ro myang ba med pa'i khyad par gyi lam gyi skad cig ma bzhi pa yin no //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu chos thams cad ni ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ro myang ba med pa'i khyad par gyi lam gyi skad cig ma bzhi pa yin no //
translated: This is the fourth moment of the path of distinctive features, which is free from savoring.

original: 'di dag ni khyad par gyi mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag ni khyad par gyi mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: These are the distinctive features.

original: rab 'byor gyi gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyi gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said:

original: bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub don du gnyer zhing /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub don du gnyer zhing /
translated: Blessed One, when all phenomena are empty of their own marks, bodhisattva great beings who strive for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'tshal ba ni dka' ba bgyid pa'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'tshal ba ni dka' ba bgyid pa'o //
translated: and wish to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening do something difficult.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor de de bzhin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor de de bzhin no //
translated: The Blessed One said:🔽Subhūti, that is so!

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: That is so!

original: rab 'byor chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub don du gnyer zhing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod pa
analyzed: rab 'byor chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub don du gnyer zhing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod pa
translated: who want unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: ni dka' ba byed pa'o //🔽rab 'byor 'on kyang byang chub sems dpa' @247a * //
analyzed: ni dka' ba byed pa'o // rab 'byor 'on kyang byang chub sems dpa' @247a * //
translated: are doing something difficult.

original: sems dpa' chen po rnams ni 'jig rten gyis phan pa'i phyir yang dag par zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: sems dpa' chen po rnams ni 'jig rten gyis phan pa'i phyir yang dag par zhugs pa'o //
translated: “Subhūti, moreover, bodhisattva great beings have set out for the benefit of the world.

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ni 'jig rten gyi bde ba'i phyir yang dag par zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ni 'jig rten gyi bde ba'i phyir yang dag par zhugs pa'o //
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings have set out for the happiness of the world.

original: 'jig rten gyi skyob par 'gyur bar bya'o zhes bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi skyob par 'gyur bar bya'o zhes bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par zhugs pa'o //
translated: They have set out for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, thinking, ‘We will be a refuge for the world.’

original: 'jig rten gyi skyabs su 'gyur bar bya ba dang / 'jig rten gyi gnas dang / 'jig rten gyi dpung gnyen dang / 'jig rten gyi gling dang / 'jig rten gyi yongs su 'dren pa dang / thugs brtse ba dang / mgon po dang / 'jig rten gyi rten du 'gyur bar bya'o zhes bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par zhugs so //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi skyabs su 'gyur bar bya ba dang / 'jig rten gyi gnas dang / 'jig rten gyi dpung gnyen dang / 'jig rten gyi gling dang / 'jig rten gyi yongs su 'dren pa dang / thugs brtse ba dang / mgon po dang / 'jig rten gyi rten du 'gyur bar bya'o zhes bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par zhugs so //
translated: I will become a refuge for the world, a support for the world, a protector for the world, an island, a light, a haven, an abode, a refuge, a final relief, and an emancipator for the world.

original: rab 'byor ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'jig rten gyi phan pa'i phyir yang dag par zhugs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'jig rten gyi phan pa'i phyir yang dag par zhugs pa yin zhe na /
translated: “Subhūti, how is it that bodhisattva great beings set out for the benefit of the world?

original: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can rnams 'gro ba rgyud lnga nas yongs su bkrol zhing mi 'jigs pa'i thang bde ba mya ngan las 'das pa la 'god do //
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can rnams 'gro ba rgyud lnga nas yongs su bkrol zhing mi 'jigs pa'i thang bde ba mya ngan las 'das pa la 'god do //
translated: Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings liberate beings from the five destinies and establish them in the happy, fearless, peaceful state of nirvāṇa.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod cing 'jig rten la phan pa'i phyir yang dag par zhugs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod cing 'jig rten la phan pa'i phyir yang dag par zhugs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni
translated: In this way, Subhūti, do Bodhisattva-Mahāsattvas, who wish to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, set out for the benefit of the world.

original: phan pa'i byed pa yin no //
analyzed: phan pa'i byed pa yin no //
translated: This is the beneficial activity.

original: rab 'byor ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'jig rten la bde ba'i phyir yang dag par zhugs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'jig rten la bde ba'i phyir yang dag par zhugs pa yin zhe na /
translated: Subhūti, how do Bodhisattva-Mahāsattvas set out for the happiness of the world?

original: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pas sems can rnams sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams las yongs su bkrol zhing mi 'jigs pa'i thang bde ba mya ngan las 'das pa la rab tu 'god do //
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pas sems can rnams sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams las yongs su bkrol zhing mi 'jigs pa'i thang bde ba mya ngan las 'das pa la rab tu 'god do //
translated: Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings who want to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening liberate beings from suffering, unhappiness, and disturbances, and establish them in the happiness of nirvāṇa, a place of safety.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod cing 'jig rten la bde ba'i phyir yang dag par zhugs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod cing 'jig rten la bde ba'i phyir yang dag par zhugs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings who want to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening in that way are correctly engaged for the happiness of the world.

original: bde ba'i byed pa yin no //
analyzed: bde ba'i byed pa yin no //
translated: This is the activity of happiness.

original: rab 'byor ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs @247b pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod cing 'jig rten gyi skyob pa'i byed pa yin zhe na /🔽rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yan dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas 'khor ba na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal gang ci yang rung ste de dag las yang sems can rnams yongs
analyzed: rab 'byor ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs @247b pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod cing 'jig rten gyi skyob pa'i byed pa yin zhe na / rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yan dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas 'khor ba na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal gang ci yang rung ste de dag las yang sems can rnams yongs
translated: Subhuti: How, O Lord, do the Bodhisattvas, the great beings, who have stood in the perfection of wisdom, become the saviors of the world?

original: su skyob cing de dag spang ba'i phyir chos ston te /
analyzed: su skyob cing de dag spang ba'i phyir chos ston te /
translated: The Lord: Here the Bodhisattva, the great being, having fully known the supreme enlightenment, saves beings from the suffering which occurs in the course of transmigration, and he preaches the Dharma to them so that they may give up that suffering.

original: de dag gis kyang chos de thos nas rim gyis theg pa gsum gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag gis kyang chos de thos nas rim gyis theg pa gsum gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur te /
translated: And when they have heard that Dharma, they gradually pass into Nirvana through the three vehicles.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas 'jig rten gyi skyob par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni skyob pa'i byed pa yin no🔽/ // / bam po bzhi bcu bdun pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas 'jig rten gyi skyob par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni skyob pa'i byed pa yin no / // / bam po bzhi bcu bdun pa /
translated: In this way, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, become a refuge for the world.”

original: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pa 'jig rten gyi skyabs su 'gyur ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pa 'jig rten gyi skyabs su 'gyur ba yin zhe na /
translated: “Subhūti, in that way bodhisattva great beings, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, become a refuge for the world.

original: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas sems can skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas sems can skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang /
translated: Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, rescue beings from birth, old age, sickness, and death,

original: mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa'i chos can rnams skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang /🔽sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa las yongs su bkrol zhing phung po ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa la rab tu 'god do //🔽rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'jig rten gyi skyabs byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni skyabs kyi byed pa yin no //
analyzed: mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa'i chos can rnams skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa las yongs su bkrol zhing phung po ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa la rab tu 'god do // rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'jig rten gyi skyabs byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni skyabs kyi byed pa yin no //
translated: and they are born with the dharmas of sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and perturbation, and they die with the dharmas of sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and perturbation;🔽and they are delivered from birth, old age, sickness, and death, from sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and perturbation, and are established in the realm of nirvana without any remainder of the aggregates.🔽In this way, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great beings are a refuge for the world.”🔽
