original: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas sems can rnams la chos thams cad 'dre ba med par ston to //🔽rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' @248a * //
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas sems can rnams la chos thams cad 'dre ba med par ston to // rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' @248a * //
translated: Subhūti, here, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, bodhisattva great beings teach all dharmas to be unadulterated.

original: chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas sems can rnams kyi gnas su 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas sems can rnams kyi gnas su 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, become a support for beings.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na chos thams cad 'dre ba ma mchis pa lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na chos thams cad 'dre ba ma mchis pa lags /
translated: “Lord, how are all dharmas unadulterated?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor gzugs kyi 'dre ba med pa gang yin pa de ni gzugs kyi 'brel pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor gzugs kyi 'dre ba med pa gang yin pa de ni gzugs kyi 'brel pa med pa'o //
translated: “Subhūti, the unadulteratedness of form is the nonconnection of form.

original: gzugs kyi 'brel ba med pa gang yin pa de ni gzugs kyi skye ba med pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi 'brel ba med pa gang yin pa de ni gzugs kyi skye ba med pa'o //
translated: The nonconnection of form is the nonproduction of form.

original: gzugs kyi skye ba med pa gang yin pa de ni gzugs kyi 'gag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi skye ba med pa gang yin pa de ni gzugs kyi 'gag pa med pa'o //
translated: The non-arising of form is the non-cessation of form.

original: gzugs kyi 'gag pa med pa gang yin pa de ni gzugs kyi 'dre ba med pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi 'gag pa med pa gang yin pa de ni gzugs kyi 'dre ba med pa'o //
translated: The non-cessation of form is the non-confusion of form.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i 'dre ba med pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par shes pa'i 'brel pa med pa'o //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i 'dre ba med pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par shes pa'i 'brel pa med pa'o //
translated: The non-confusion of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness is the non-connection of consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa'i 'brel pa med pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par shes pa'i skye ba med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i 'brel pa med pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par shes pa'i skye ba med pa'o //
translated: The non-connection of consciousness is the non-arising of consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa'i skye ba med pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par shes pa'i 'gag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i skye ba med pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par shes pa'i 'gag pa med pa'o //
translated: The non-arising of consciousness is the non-cessation of consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa'i 'gag pa med pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par shes pa'i 'dre ba med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i 'gag pa med pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par shes pa'i 'dre ba med pa'o //
translated: The non-cessation of consciousness is the non-confusion of consciousness.

original: de bzhin du phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag rnams dang / pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag rnams dang / pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang /
translated: Similarly, the aggregates, the constituents, the sense fields, the links of dependent origination, all the perfections, all the emptinesses, the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment,

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / tshad med pa dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad rnams dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu rnams dang / stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / tshad med pa dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad rnams dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu rnams dang / stong pa nyid dang /
translated: the noble truths, the immeasurables, the concentrations, the formless absorptions, the eight liberations, the nine serial absorptions, emptiness,

original: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang /
translated: signlessness, and aspirationlessness, the higher cognitions, all the meditative stabilizations, all the dhāraṇī gateways, the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi 'dre ba med pa gang yin pa de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi 'brel pa med pa'o //🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi 'brel pa med pa gang yin pa de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi skye ba med @248b pa'o ;🔽/ rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi skye ba med pa gang yin pa de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi 'gag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi 'dre ba med pa gang yin pa de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi 'brel pa med pa'o // rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi 'brel pa med pa gang yin pa de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi skye ba med @248b pa'o ; / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi skye ba med pa gang yin pa de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi 'gag pa med pa'o //
translated: The absence of connection with the powers, the absence of connection with the grounds of self-confidence, the absence of connection with the detailed and thorough knowledges, the absence of connection with the aspects of the path, the absence of connection with the dhyānas, the absence of connection with the formless [absorptions], the absence of connection with the formless [absorptions], the absence of connection with the formless [absorptions], the absence of connection with the immeasurables, the absence of connection with the liberations, the absence of connection with the correct and discerning knowledges, the absence of connection with the meditative stabilizations, the absence of connection with the dhāraṇī gateways, the absence of connection with the ten tathāgata powers, the absence of connection with the four fearlessnesses, the absence of connection with the four detailed and thorough knowledges, the absence of connection with the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, and the absence of connection with omniscience—that is the absence of connection with omniscience.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi 'gag pa med pa gang yin pa de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi 'dre ba med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi 'gag pa med pa gang yin pa de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi 'dre ba med pa'o //
translated: The absence of connection with omniscience is the non-production of omniscience.🔽The non-production of omniscience is the non-cessation of omniscience.🔽The non-cessation of omniscience is the absence of connection with omniscience.🔽The absence of connection with omniscience is the absence of connection with the perfection of giving.🔽The absence of connection with the perfection of giving is the absence of connection with the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas sems can rnams la chos thams cad 'dre ba med par chos ston to zhes bya ba ni gnas
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas sems can rnams la chos thams cad 'dre ba med par chos ston to zhes bya ba ni gnas
translated: In this way, Subhūti, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, bodhisattva great beings teach the doctrine to sentient beings, without mixing any doctrines.

original: kyi byed pa yin no //
analyzed: kyi byed pa yin no //
translated: This is the function of the abode.

original: rab 'byor ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pa 'jig rten gyi dpung gnyen du 'gyur ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pa 'jig rten gyi dpung gnyen du 'gyur ba yin zhe na /
translated: “Subhūti, how do bodhisattva great beings who want to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening become the world’s protector?

original: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas sems can rnams la chos 'di ltar ston te /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas sems can rnams la chos 'di ltar ston te /
translated: Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, teach the doctrine to sentient beings in this way:

original: gzugs kyi pha rol gang yin pa de ni gzugs ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs kyi pha rol gang yin pa de ni gzugs ma yin no //
translated: The other shore of form is not form.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i pha rol gang yin pa de ni rnam par shes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i pha rol gang yin pa de ni rnam par shes pa ma yin no //
translated: The other shore of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness is not consciousness.

original: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i pha rol gang yin pa de ni phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i pha rol gang yin pa de ni phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: The other shore of the heaps, constituents, sense fields, and dependent origination is not the heaps, constituents, sense fields, and dependent origination.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad kyi pha rol gang yin pa da ni pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad kyi pha rol gang yin pa da ni pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin no //
translated: The other shore of all the perfections is not a perfection.

original: stong pa nyid thams cad kyi pha rol gang yin pa de ni stong pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid thams cad kyi pha rol gang yin pa de ni stong pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: The other shore of all emptinesses is not an emptiness.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyi pha rol gang yin pa de ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams ma yin no //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyi pha rol gang yin pa de ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams ma yin no //
translated: The other shore of the dharmas on the side of awakening is not the dharmas on the side of awakening.

original: de bzhin du 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / tshad med pa dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / tshad med pa dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang /
translated: The emptiness of form, the emptiness of sound, the emptiness of smell, the emptiness of taste, the emptiness of tangibles, and the emptiness of dharmas are not the perfection of wisdom.🔽The emptiness of the eye constituent, the emptiness of the form constituent, the emptiness of the eye consciousness constituent, the emptiness of the ear constituent, the emptiness of sound constituent, the emptiness of the ear consciousness constituent, the emptiness of the nose constituent, the emptiness of smell constituent, the emptiness of the nose consciousness constituent, the emptiness of the tongue constituent, the emptiness of taste constituent, the emptiness of the tongue consciousness constituent, the emptiness of the body constituent, the emptiness of tangible objects constituent, the emptiness of the body consciousness constituent, the emptiness of the thinking-mind constituent, the emptiness of dharmas constituent, and the emptiness of the thinking-mind consciousness constituent are not the perfection of wisdom.🔽The emptiness of the perfection of giving, the emptiness of the perfection of morality, the emptiness of the perfection of patience, the emptiness of the perfection of perseverance, the emptiness of the perfection of concentration, and the emptiness of the perfection of wisdom are not the perfection of wisdom.

original: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi pha rol gang yin pa de ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma @249a * //🔽'dres pa rnams ma yin no //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi pha rol gang yin pa de ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma @249a * // 'dres pa rnams ma yin no //
translated: The emptiness of the applications of mindfulness, the emptiness of the right efforts, the emptiness of the legs of miraculous power, the emptiness of the faculties, the emptiness of the powers, the emptiness of the branches of enlightenment, and the emptiness of the path are not the perfection of wisdom.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi pha rol gang yin pa de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi pha rol gang yin pa de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: The emptiness of the fruit of the stream enterer, the emptiness of the fruit of the once-returner, the emptiness of the fruit of the non-returner, the emptiness of the fruit of the worthy one, the emptiness of the pratyekabuddha’s awakening, and the emptiness of the knowledge of all aspects are not the perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor gzugs ji lta bar chos thams cad kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor gzugs ji lta bar chos thams cad kyang de bzhin no //
translated: The emptiness of the perfection of giving, the emptiness of the perfection of morality, the emptiness of

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar yang de bzhin no //
translated: and so on up to: the knowledge of all modes is just so.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhuti :

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te gzugs ji lta bar chos thams cad kyang de bzhin lags na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te gzugs ji lta bar chos thams cad kyang de bzhin lags na /
translated: If, O Lord, all dharmas are just so,

original: 'o na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'o na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa nyid do //
translated: then the Bodhisattva, the great being, has fully known the knowledge of all modes.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: bcom ldan 'das gzugs kyi pha rol na rnam par rtog pa gang yang ma mchis pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gzugs kyi pha rol na rnam par rtog pa gang yang ma mchis pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, O Lord, there is no dharma on the other side of form, etc.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i pha rol na rnam par rtog pa gang yang ma mchis pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i pha rol na rnam par rtog pa gang yang ma mchis pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no dharma on the other side of feeling, perception, will, or consciousness.

original: mngon par shes pa rnams dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi pha rol na rnam par rtog pa gang yang ma mchis pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa rnams dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi pha rol na rnam par rtog pa gang yang ma mchis pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no conceptualization whatsoever on the other side of the superknowledges, the ten powers, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, and the distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi pha rol na rnam par rtog pa gang yang ma mchis pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi pha rol na rnam par rtog pa gang yang ma mchis pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because there is no conceptualization whatsoever on the other side of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: 'di ni gzugs so //
analyzed: 'di ni gzugs so //
translated: This is form,

original: 'di ni tshor ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni tshor ba'o //
translated: this is feeling,

original: 'di ni 'du shes so //
analyzed: 'di ni 'du shes so //
translated: this is perception,

original: 'di ni 'du byed rnams so //
analyzed: 'di ni 'du byed rnams so //
translated: this is volitional factors,

original: 'di ni rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: this is consciousness,

original: 'di ni phung po rnams so //🔽'di ni khams rnams so //
analyzed: 'di ni phung po rnams so // 'di ni khams rnams so //
translated: this is the aggregates,🔽this is the constituents,

original: 'di ni skye mched rnams so //🔽'di ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rnams so //
analyzed: 'di ni skye mched rnams so // 'di ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rnams so //
translated: this is the sense fields,🔽this is dependent origination,

original: 'di ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag rnams so //
analyzed: 'di ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag rnams so //
translated: this is the links of dependent origination,

original: 'di ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'di ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnams so //
translated: this is the perfections,

original: 'di ni stong pa nyid rnams so //
analyzed: 'di ni stong pa nyid rnams so //
translated: this is the emptinesses,

original: 'di ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams so //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams so //
translated: These are the factors of awakening.

original: 'di ni 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'di ni 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams so //
translated: These are the noble truths.

original: 'di ni mngon par shes pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'di ni mngon par shes pa rnams so //
translated: These are the superknowledges.

original: 'di ni tshad med pa dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'di ni tshad med pa dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams so //
translated: These are the immeasurables, concentrations, and formless absorptions.

original: 'di ni rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams so //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams so //
translated: These are the liberations, meditative stabilizations, and dhāraṇī gateways.

original: 'di ni stong pa nyid dang ; mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'di ni stong pa nyid dang ; mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa rnams so //
translated: These are emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: 'di ni stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'di ni stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams so //
translated: These are the ten powers, fearlessnesses, detailed and thorough knowledges, and distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: 'di ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa gang yang ma mchis pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa gang yang ma mchis pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is the knowledge of all aspects.”

original: bcom @249b ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom @249b ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor de de bzhin no //
translated: “Subhūti, it is so!

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said!

original: gzugs kyi pha rol na rnam par rtog pa gang yang med do //
analyzed: gzugs kyi pha rol na rnam par rtog pa gang yang med do //
translated: There is no conceptualization whatsoever beyond form.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i pha rol na rnam par rtog pa gang yang med do //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i pha rol na rnam par rtog pa gang yang med do //
translated: There is no conceptualization whatsoever beyond feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.

original: de bzhin du phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang ; rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag rnams kyi pha rol na rnam par rtog pa gang yang med do //
analyzed: de bzhin du phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang ; rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag rnams kyi pha rol na rnam par rtog pa gang yang med do //
translated: Similarly, there is no conceptualization whatsoever beyond the heaps, the constituents, the sense fields, dependent origination, or the links of dependent origination.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams kyi pha rol na rnam par rtog pa gang yang med do //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams kyi pha rol na rnam par rtog pa gang yang med do //
translated: There is no conceptualization whatsoever beyond the perfections, all the emptinesses, the dharmas on the side of awakening, the immeasurables, the concentrations, or the formless absorptions.

original: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi pha rol na rnam par rtog pa gang yang med do //
analyzed: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi pha rol na rnam par rtog pa gang yang med do //
translated: There are no conceptualizations whatsoever beyond the ten powers, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, and the distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi pha rol na rnam par rtog pa gang yang med de /🔽de ltar na yang rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams de lta bu'i chos 'di la rtog pa med la zhum par mi byed pas bdag gis 'di ltar chos de dag mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi pha rol na rnam par rtog pa gang yang med de / de ltar na yang rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams de lta bu'i chos 'di la rtog pa med la zhum par mi byed pas bdag gis 'di ltar chos de dag mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par bya'o //
translated: There are no conceptualizations whatsoever beyond the knowledge of all aspects.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'di ltar mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas chos de ltar zhi ba dang / de ltar bzang ba de dag bshad par bya'o snyam du sems pa ni dka' ba byed pa ste /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'di ltar mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas chos de ltar zhi ba dang / de ltar bzang ba de dag bshad par bya'o snyam du sems pa ni dka' ba byed pa ste /
translated: In that way, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings, without conceptualizing those dharmas, do not get discouraged, thinking, ‘I must fully awaken to those dharmas,’ and ‘I must fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening like that, and having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening like that, I must teach those dharmas that are that peaceful, that good.’

original: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas 'jig rten pa rnams kyi dpung gnyen byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni dpung gnyen gyi byed
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas 'jig rten pa rnams kyi dpung gnyen byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni dpung gnyen gyi byed
translated: In this way, Subhūti, the bodhisattva mahāsattva, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, acts as a protector for the world’s beings.”

original: pa yin no //
analyzed: pa yin no //
translated: This is the activity of being a protector.

original: rab 'byor ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas 'jig rten gyi gling yin zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas 'jig rten gyi gling yin zhe na /
translated: “Subhūti, how is it that the bodhisattva mahāsattva, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, is an island for the world’s beings?🔽Subhūti, it is like this:

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /🔽chu klung chen po rnams sam /🔽rgya mtsho chen po rnams sam /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na / chu klung chen po rnams sam / rgya mtsho chen po rnams sam /
translated: for example,🔽those places that are completely surrounded by water

original: chus yongs su chad pa'i gnas gang yin pa de dag ni gling zhes brjod do //
analyzed: chus yongs su chad pa'i gnas gang yin pa de dag ni gling zhes brjod do //
translated: are called islands.

original: rab 'byor de bzhin du gzugs ni sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' yongs su chad pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin du gzugs ni sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' yongs su chad pa'o //
translated: Subhūti, in the same way, form is completely surrounded by the past and future.

original: rab 'byor de bzhin du /
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin du /
translated: In the same way, Subhūti,

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams @250a * //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams @250a * //
translated: feeling, perception, volitional factors,

original: dang ; rnam par shes pa ni sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' yongs su chad pa'o //
analyzed: dang ; rnam par shes pa ni sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' yongs su chad pa'o //
translated: and consciousness are cut off from a prior limit and a later limit.

original: de bzhin du phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag rnams kyi sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' yongs su chad pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag rnams kyi sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' yongs su chad pa'o //
translated: In the same way, the aggregates, the constituents, the sense fields, dependent origination, and the limbs of dependent origination are cut off from a prior limit and a later limit.

original: de bzhin du sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' yongs su chad pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' yongs su chad pa'o //
translated: In the same way, the perfection of giving is cut off from a prior limit and a later limit.

original: de bzhin du tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' yongs su chad pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' yongs su chad pa'o //
translated: In the same way, the perfections of morality, patience, perseverance, concentration, and wisdom are cut off from a prior limit and a later limit.

original: nang stong pa nyid ni sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' yongs su chad pa'o //
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid ni sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' yongs su chad pa'o //
translated: The emptiness of internal phenomena is cut off from a prior limit and a later limit.

original: phyi stong pa nyid ni sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' yongs su chad pa'o //
analyzed: phyi stong pa nyid ni sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' yongs su chad pa'o //
translated: The emptiness of external phenomena is cut off from a prior limit and a later limit.

original: phyi nang stong pa nyid ni sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' yongs su chad pa'o //
analyzed: phyi nang stong pa nyid ni sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' yongs su chad pa'o //
translated: The emptiness of both internal and external phenomena is cut off from a prior limit and a later limit.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar ni sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' yongs su chad pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar ni sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' yongs su chad pa'o //
translated: Up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature is cut off from a prior limit and a later limit.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun rnams ni sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' yongs su chad pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun rnams ni sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' yongs su chad pa'o //
translated: The thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening are cut off from a prior limit and a later limit.

original: tshad med pa dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams ni sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' yongs su chad pa'o //
analyzed: tshad med pa dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams ni sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' yongs su chad pa'o //
translated: The immeasurables, the concentrations, and the formless absorptions are cut off from a prior limit and a later limit.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams ni sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' yongs su chad pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams ni sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' yongs su chad pa'o //
translated: The four noble truths are limited to the past and future.

original: rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams ni sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' yongs su chad pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams ni sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' yongs su chad pa'o //
translated: The gateways to liberation, the meditative absorptions, the meditative stabilities, and the dhāraṇī gateways are limited to the past and future.

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams ni sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' yongs su chad pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams ni sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' yongs su chad pa'o //
translated: Emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, and the extrasensory powers are limited to the past and future.

original: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams ni sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' yongs su chad pa'o //
analyzed: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams ni sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' yongs su chad pa'o //
translated: The ten powers, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, and the distinct attributes of a buddha are limited to the past and future.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar ni sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' yongs su chad pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar ni sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' yongs su chad pa'o //
translated: Up to and including the knowledge of all aspects, they are limited to the past and future.🔽Subhūti, it is thus that the past and future are limited.

original: rab mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: rab mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: Subhūti, the past and future are limited.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub des ni chos thams cad yongs su chad pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub des ni chos thams cad yongs su chad pa ste /
translated: In this way, Subhūti, that awakening cuts off all dharmas.

original: rab 'byor chos thams cad kyi sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' @250b yongs su chad pa gang yin pa de ni zhi ba'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor chos thams cad kyi sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' @250b yongs su chad pa gang yin pa de ni zhi ba'o //
translated: Subhūti, the cutting off of the prior limit and the later limit of all dharmas is peace.

original: de ni bzang ba'o //
analyzed: de ni bzang ba'o //
translated: It is good.

original: de ni yang dag pa'o //
analyzed: de ni yang dag pa'o //
translated: It is real.

original: 'di lta ste stong pa nyid dang / dmigs su med pa dang / lam gyi rgyun chad pa dang / sred pa zad pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste stong pa nyid dang / dmigs su med pa dang / lam gyi rgyun chad pa dang / sred pa zad pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: It is emptiness, the absence of a referent, the cutting off of the continuum of the path, the exhaustion of craving, freedom from attachment, cessation, and nirvāṇa.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas chos thams cad kyi sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' yongs su chad pa ston pas 'jig rten pa rnams kyi gling gi byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas chos thams cad kyi sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' yongs su chad pa ston pas 'jig rten pa rnams kyi gling gi byed pa yin no //
translated: Subhūti, in this way, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, bodhisattva great beings, by teaching the cutting off of the prior limit and the later limit of all dharmas, act as an island for the world.

original: rab 'byor ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas 'jig rten pa rnams kyi snang ba byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas 'jig rten pa rnams kyi snang ba byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: “Subhūti, how do bodhisattva great beings, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, act as a light for the world?

original: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yun ring du ma rig pa'i sgo nga'i sbu bas kyis kun nas g-yogs shing mun pas zil gyis gnon pa'i sems can rnams la shes rab kyi snang bas ma rig pa'i mun pa mun nag sel bar
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yun ring du ma rig pa'i sgo nga'i sbu bas kyis kun nas g-yogs shing mun pas zil gyis gnon pa'i sems can rnams la shes rab kyi snang bas ma rig pa'i mun pa mun nag sel bar
translated: “Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings, for the sake of beings covered by the shell of long-standing nescience, overcome by darkness, dispel the darkness of nescience with the light of wisdom,

original: byed cing rab rib med par byed do //
analyzed: byed cing rab rib med par byed do //
translated: and make them free of eye disease.🔽“Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, act in that way as a light for the world.”

original: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas 'jig rten gyi snang ba byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas 'jig rten gyi snang ba byed pa yin no //
translated: “Subhūti, how do bodhisattva great beings, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, act as a refuge for the world?

original: rab 'byor ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas sems can rnams kyi sgron ma 'dzin cing 'od 'byin pa yin zhe na /🔽rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas mdo de gang pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang ldan pa bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi dang ldan pa
analyzed: rab 'byor ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas sems can rnams kyi sgron ma 'dzin cing 'od 'byin pa yin zhe na / rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas mdo de gang pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang ldan pa bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi dang ldan pa
translated: “Subhūti, how do bodhisattva great beings, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, hold up a lamp for beings and emit light?

original: de dag gi don ma nor bar sems can rnams la yang dag par ston te sems can rnams kyang de la yang dag par bskul zhing sbyor ba la rab tu 'god de /
analyzed: de dag gi don ma nor bar sems can rnams la yang dag par ston te sems can rnams kyang de la yang dag par bskul zhing sbyor ba la rab tu 'god de /
translated: “Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, teach the meaning of those sūtras that are endowed with the six perfections and the four means of gathering beings correctly to beings without distorting it, and they also encourage beings and establish them in it.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas sems can rnams kyi sgron ma 'dzin cing 'od 'byin pa yin no //🔽rab 'byor ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs @251a * //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas sems can rnams kyi sgron ma 'dzin cing 'od 'byin pa yin no // rab 'byor ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs @251a * //
translated: In this way, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great beings, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, hold up the lamp for beings and emit light.

original: pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas sems can rnams kyi ded dpon byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas sems can rnams kyi ded dpon byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: “Subhūti, how do bodhisattva great beings, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, act as a guide for beings?

original: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas sems can lam ngan par zhugs pa'i 'gro ba bzhi po rnams la sems can rnam par dag par bya
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas sems can lam ngan par zhugs pa'i 'gro ba bzhi po rnams la sems can rnam par dag par bya
translated: Subhūti, here the bodhisattva great beings, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, purify the four groups of beings who have entered the wrong path.

original: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can gyi ris la thugs rje chen po bskyed de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas sems can rnams la gzugs kyi skye ba med🔽pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa'i phyir chos ston te /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can gyi ris la thugs rje chen po bskyed de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas sems can rnams la gzugs kyi skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa'i phyir chos ston te /
translated: Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings, having generated great compassion for the class of sentient beings, after fully awakening to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, teach the Dharma to sentient beings,🔽and perfectly illuminate it, because of the non-arising, non-ceasing, non-affliction, and non-purification of form.

original: yang dag par rab tu gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu gsal bar byed do //
translated: They teach the Dharma,

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa'i phyir chos ston te /🔽yang dag par rab tu gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa'i phyir chos ston te /🔽yang dag par rab tu gsal bar byed do //
translated: and perfectly illuminate it, because of the non-arising, non-ceasing, non-affliction, and non-purification of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness.

original: de bzhin du sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang /

translated: In the same way, he teaches the Dharma and illuminates it well, saying that the perfections of generosity,

analyzed: rnam par byang ba med pa'i phyir chos ston te /

translated: unpurified.🔽He teaches the Dharma and illuminates it well, saying that the perfections of skillful means,

analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa'i phyir chos ston te /
translated: aspirations, power, and wisdom are unborn, unceasing,🔽unpolluted, and

original: yang dag par rab tu gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu gsal bar byed do //
translated: unpurified.

original: nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang /

translated: the emptiness of internal phenomena, the emptiness of external phenomena, the emptiness of both external and internal phenomena, up to the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities,

original: rnam par byang ba med pa'i phyir chos ston te /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba med pa'i phyir chos ston te /
translated: he teaches the Dharma, saying: ‘There is no arising, no cessation, no affliction,

original: yang dag par rab tu gsal bar byed do //🔽byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun rnams dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / mngon par shes pa rnams kyi skye ba med pa dang /🔽'gag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa'i phyir chos ston te /
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu gsal bar byed do // byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun rnams dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / mngon par shes pa rnams kyi skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa'i phyir chos ston te /
translated: and no purification.’🔽He teaches the Dharma, saying: ‘The thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment, the noble truths, the immeasurables, the concentrations, the formless absorptions, and the superknowledges🔽have no arising, no cessation, no affliction, and no purification.’

original: yang dag par rab tu gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu gsal bar byed do //
translated: He teaches the Dharma, saying: ‘The ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four kinds of exact knowledge, great love, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas🔽have no arising, no cessation, no affliction, and no purification.’

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa rnams kyi skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang /🔽rnam par byang ba med pa'i phyir chos ston te /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa rnams kyi skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa'i phyir chos ston te /
translated: the eight liberations, the nine serial absorptions, emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness,

original: yang dag par rab tu gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu gsal bar byed do //
translated: he teaches the Dharma that they are unborn, unceasing, uncontaminated, and unpurified.🔽He teaches the Dharma that they are unborn, unceasing, uncontaminated, and unpurified.

original: de bzhin du ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / stobs bcu rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad rnams skye ba med pa dang /🔽'gag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa'i phyir chos ston te /
analyzed: de bzhin du ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / stobs bcu rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad rnams skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa'i phyir chos ston te /
translated: Similarly, he teaches the Dharma that all the meditative stabilities, all the dhāraṇī gateways, the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are unborn,🔽unobstructed, uncontaminated, and unpurified.

original: yang dag par rab tu gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu gsal bar byed do //
translated: He teaches the Dharma that they are unborn, unceasing, uncontaminated, and unpurified.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa'i phyir chos ston te /🔽yang dag par rab tu gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa'i phyir chos ston te / yang dag par rab tu gsal bar byed do //
translated: He teaches the Dharma because the knowledge of all aspects is non-arising, non-ceasing, non-afflicted, and non-purified.🔽He teaches the Dharma because the knowledge of paths is non-arising, non-ceasing, non-afflicted, and non-purified.🔽He teaches the Dharma because the knowledge of all aspects is non-arising, non-ceasing, non-afflicted, and non-purified.🔽He teaches the Dharma because the knowledge of paths is non-arising, non-ceasing, non-afflicted, and non-purified.

original: rang byang chub skye ba med pa dang ; 'gag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa'i phyir chos ston te /🔽yang dag par rab tu gsal bar byed do //🔽rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa'i phyir @252a * //
analyzed: rang byang chub skye ba med pa dang ; 'gag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa'i phyir chos ston te / yang dag par rab tu gsal bar byed do // rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa'i phyir @252a * //
translated: He teaches the Dharma because the knowledge of all aspects is non-arising, non-ceasing, non-afflicted, and non-purified.🔽He teaches the Dharma because the knowledge of paths is non-arising, non-ceasing, non-afflicted, and non-purified.🔽He teaches the Dharma because the knowledge of all aspects is non-arising, non-ceasing, non-afflicted, and non-purified.🔽He teaches the Dharma because the knowledge of paths is non-arising, non-ceasing, non-afflicted, and non-purified.🔽He teaches the Dharma because the knowledge of all aspects is non-arising, non-ceasing, non-afflicted, and non-purified.

original: chos ston te /🔽yang dag par rab tu gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: chos ston te /🔽yang dag par rab tu gsal bar byed do //
translated: He teaches the Dharma because the knowledge of paths is non-arising, non-ceasing, non-afflicted

original: de bzhin du lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa'i phyir chos ston te /
analyzed: de bzhin du lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa'i phyir chos ston te /
translated: In the same way, he teaches the doctrine that the fruit of once-returning, the fruit of non-returning, and the fruit of arhatship are non-arising and do not cease, are uncontaminated and do not become pure.

original: yang dag par rab tu gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu gsal bar byed do //
translated: He teaches the doctrine and reveals it in a way that is utterly lucid.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas sems can rnams kyi yongs su 'dren pa byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni yongs su 'dren🔽pa byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni yongs su 'dren pa byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas sems can rnams kyi yongs su 'dren pa byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni yongs su 'dren🔽pa byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni yongs su 'dren pa byed pa yin no //
translated: In this way, Subhūti, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, bodhisattva great beings act as guides for sentient beings.

original: rab 'byor ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas sems can rnams kyi rten byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas sems can rnams kyi rten byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: “Subhūti, how do bodhisattva great beings, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, act as a support for beings?

original: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas sems can rmongs pa rten med pa rnams kyi rten byed pa yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas sems can rmongs pa rten med pa rnams kyi rten byed pa yin te /
translated: “Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, act as a support for beings who are confused and without a support.

original: gzugs ni nam mkha'i ngang tshul can no zhes bya bar sems can rnams la chos ston te /
analyzed: gzugs ni nam mkha'i ngang tshul can no zhes bya bar sems can rnams la chos ston te /
translated: They teach the doctrine to beings, saying, ‘Form is the nature of space.’

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ni nam mkha'i ngang tshul can zhes bya bar sems can rnams la chos ston te /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ni nam mkha'i ngang tshul can zhes bya bar sems can rnams la chos ston te /
translated: They teach the doctrine to beings, saying, ‘Feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are the nature of space.’

original: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag rnams ni nam mkha'i ngang tshul can zhes bya bar sems can rnams la chos ston to //
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag rnams ni nam mkha'i ngang tshul can zhes bya bar sems can rnams la chos ston to //
translated: He teaches the Dharma to beings, saying, ‘The aggregates, elements, sense-spheres, dependent origination, and the factors of dependent origination are like space.’

original: de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / tshad med pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / tshad med pa dang /
translated: In the same way, he teaches the Dharma to beings, saying, ‘All the perfections, all the emptinesses, all the meditative stabilizations, all the dhāraṇī gateways, the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, the immeasurables,

original: bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: the concentrations, the formless absorptions, the noble truths, the eight deliverances, the nine serial absorptions, emptiness, signlessness,

original: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad rnams ni nam mkha'i ngang tshul @252b can zhes bya bar sems can rnams la chos ston to //
analyzed: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad rnams ni nam mkha'i ngang tshul @252b can zhes bya bar sems can rnams la chos ston to //
translated: He teaches beings the doctrine, saying: ‘The ten powers of a tathāgata, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha have the nature of space.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni nam mkha'i ngang tshul can zhes bya bar sems can rnams la chos ston to //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni nam mkha'i ngang tshul can zhes bya bar sems can rnams la chos ston to //
translated: He teaches beings the doctrine, saying: ‘The knowledge of all aspects has the nature of space.

original: gzugs kyi stong pa nyid ni 'ong ba med pa'i ngang tshul can te /
analyzed: gzugs kyi stong pa nyid ni 'ong ba med pa'i ngang tshul can te /
translated: The emptiness of form has the nature of not coming.

original: de ni mi 'ong mi 'gro zhes bya bar sems can rnams la chos ston to //
analyzed: de ni mi 'ong mi 'gro zhes bya bar sems can rnams la chos ston to //
translated: He teaches beings the doctrine, saying: ‘It does not come and it does not go.

original: tshor pa dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i stong pa nyid ni 'ong ba med pa'i ngang tshul can te de dag ni mi 'ong mi 'gro zhes bya bar sems can rnams la chos ston to //
analyzed: tshor pa dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i stong pa nyid ni 'ong ba med pa'i ngang tshul can te de dag ni mi 'ong mi 'gro zhes bya bar sems can rnams la chos ston to //
translated: The emptiness of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness has the nature of not coming. He teaches beings the doctrine, saying: ‘It does not come and it does not go.’🔽“Furthermore, Śāriputra, the bodhisattva great being who is practicing the perfection of wisdom teaches beings the doctrine, saying: ‘The emptiness of internal phenomena has the nature of not coming.

original: de bzhin du phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag rnams kyi stong pa nyid ni 'ong ba med pa'i ngang tshul can te /
analyzed: de bzhin du phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag rnams kyi stong pa nyid ni 'ong ba med pa'i ngang tshul can te /
translated: In the same way, the emptiness of the aggregates, elements, sense-spheres, dependent origination, and the factors of dependent origination is such that it does not come.

original: de ni mi 'ong mi 'gro zhes bya bar sems can rnams la chos ston to //
analyzed: de ni mi 'ong mi 'gro zhes bya bar sems can rnams la chos ston to //
translated: He teaches the Dharma to beings, saying: “It does not come, it does not go.”

original: de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / rnam par thar pa thams cad dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams kyi stong pa nyid ni 'ong ba med pa'i ngang tshul can te /
analyzed: de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / rnam par thar pa thams cad dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams kyi stong pa nyid ni 'ong ba med pa'i ngang tshul can te /
translated: In the same way, the emptiness of all the perfections, all the emptinesses, all the liberations, the meditative stabilizations, the absorptions, and the dhāraṇī gateways is such that it does not come.

original: de ni mi 'ong mi 'gro zhes bya bar sems can rnams la chos ston to //
analyzed: de ni mi 'ong mi 'gro zhes bya bar sems can rnams la chos ston to //
translated: He teaches the Dharma to beings, saying: “It does not come, it does not go.”

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams dang / yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam rnams kyi stong pa nyid 'ong ba med pa'i ngang tshul can te /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams dang / yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam rnams kyi stong pa nyid 'ong ba med pa'i ngang tshul can te /
translated: The emptiness of the applications of mindfulness, the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the branches of enlightenment, and the noble eightfold path

original: de ni mi 'ong mi 'gro zhes bya bar sems can rnams la chos ston to //
analyzed: de ni mi 'ong mi 'gro zhes bya bar sems can rnams la chos ston to //
translated: is such that it does not come and does not go.

original: tshad med pa dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams kyi stong pa nyid ni 'ong ba med pa'i ngang tshul can te /
analyzed: tshad med pa dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams kyi stong pa nyid ni 'ong ba med pa'i ngang tshul can te /
translated: The emptiness of the immeasurables, the concentrations, and the formless absorptions

original: de ni mi 'ong mi 'gro zhes bya bar sems can rnams la chos ston to //
analyzed: de ni mi 'ong mi 'gro zhes bya bar sems can rnams la chos ston to //
translated: is such that it does not come and does not go.

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams kyi stong pa nyid ni 'ong ba med pa'i ngang tshul can te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams kyi stong pa nyid ni 'ong ba med pa'i ngang tshul can te /
translated: The emptiness of the emptiness, signless, and aspirationless gateways to liberation, and the emptiness of the ten powers, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, and the distinct attributes of a buddha🔽is such that it does not come and does not go.

original: de ni mi 'ong mi 'gro zhes bya bar sems can rnams la chos ston to //
analyzed: de ni mi 'ong mi 'gro zhes bya bar sems can rnams la chos ston to //
translated: ‘It does not come and it does not go.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi stong pa nyid ni 'ong ba med pa'i ngang tshul can te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi stong pa nyid ni 'ong ba med pa'i ngang tshul can te /
translated: The emptiness of the ten powers of a tathāgata, the emptiness of the four fearlessnesses, the emptiness of the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the emptiness of the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha🔽He teaches the doctrine to beings like this:

original: de ni mi 'ong mi 'gro zhes bya bar sems can rnams la chos ston to //🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen @253a * //
analyzed: de ni mi 'ong mi 'gro zhes bya bar sems can rnams la chos ston to // rnam pa thams cad mkhyen @253a * //
translated: ‘It does not come and it does not go.

original: pa nyid kyi stong pa nyid ni 'ong ba med pa'i ngang tshul can te /
analyzed: pa nyid kyi stong pa nyid ni 'ong ba med pa'i ngang tshul can te /
translated: The emptiness of the knowledge of all aspects🔽He teaches the doctrine to beings like this:

original: de ni mi 'ong mi 'gro zhes bya bar sems can rnams la chos ston to //
analyzed: de ni mi 'ong mi 'gro zhes bya bar sems can rnams la chos ston to //
translated: ‘It does not come and it does not go.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas sems can rnams kyi rten byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas sems can rnams kyi rten byed pa yin no //
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, act as a support for beings in that way.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

analyzed: rab 'byor chos thams cad ni stong pa nyid kyi ngang tshul can te /
translated: “Subhūti, all phenomena have the nature of emptiness.

original: de dag ni ngang tshul de las mi 'da'o //

original: de dag ni ngang tshul de las mi 'da'o //

translated: and they do not pass beyond that character.

analyzed: mngon par shes pa dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi ngang tshul can te /
translated: the ten powers, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, emptiness, signlessness, wishlessness, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: de dag ni ngang tshul de las mi 'da'o //

translated: Those do not pass beyond that nature.

original: de la 'ong ba'am 'gro ba lta ga la 'gyur /

analyzed: rab 'byor chos thams cad ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i ngang tshul can te /

analyzed: de dag ni ngang tshul de las mi 'da'o //
translated: They do not pass beyond that nature.
