original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni de bzhin nyid gcig pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni de bzhin nyid gcig pa ste /
translated: The suchness of the unshared qualities of a buddha and the suchness of the knowledge of all aspects are one suchness.

original: gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do //
translated: They are not two, nor are they divided.

original: de bzhin du rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang sangs rgyas dang ; sangs rgyas nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang sangs rgyas dang ; sangs rgyas nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa ste /
translated: In the same way, the result of stream enterer, the result of once-returner, the result of non-returner, the state of a worthy one, a pratyekabuddha’s awakening, and buddhahood are the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang sangs rgyas so //
translated: And the knowledge of all aspects is a buddha.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni de bzhin nyid gcig pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni de bzhin nyid gcig pa ste /
translated: The suchness of the lord buddhas and the suchness of the knowledge of all aspects are one suchness.

original: @265b gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: @265b gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do //
translated: It is nondual and cannot be made dual.

original: lha'i bu dag don gyi dbang 'di gzigs pas de bzhin gshegs pa thugs las chung ba la gzhol ba ste /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag don gyi dbang 'di gzigs pas de bzhin gshegs pa thugs las chung ba la gzhol ba ste /
translated: “Divine princes, seeing this fact, the Thus-Gone One is inclined toward inactivity,

original: chos bstan pa la gzhol ba ma yin no //
analyzed: chos bstan pa la gzhol ba ma yin no //
translated: not toward teaching the Dharma.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / 'di lta ste /
translated: And why is that?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi chos byang chub 'di ni zab cing blta dka' la khong du chud par dka' zhing brtag tu med la rtog ge'i spyod yul ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi chos byang chub 'di ni zab cing blta dka' la khong du chud par dka' zhing brtag tu med la rtog ge'i spyod yul ma yin te /
translated: It is because this Dharma of the thus-gone ones, this awakening, is profound, difficult to see, difficult to understand, beyond the scope of logic, not to be examined, not an object of sophistry,

original: zhi ba / phra ba /
analyzed: zhi ba / phra ba /
translated: peaceful, subtle,

original: mkhas pa rnam par shes pas rig par bya ba 'jig rten thams cad dang mi mthun pa ste /🔽de ni sus kyang mngon par sangs ma rgyas /🔽nam yang mngon par sangs ma rgyas /
analyzed: mkhas pa rnam par shes pas rig par bya ba 'jig rten thams cad dang mi mthun pa ste / de ni sus kyang mngon par sangs ma rgyas / nam yang mngon par sangs ma rgyas /
translated: to be experienced by the wise and the noble ones, and not in accord with the world.🔽No one has ever fully awakened to it.🔽No one will ever fully awaken to it.

original: gang yang mngon par sangs ma rgyas pa ste /
analyzed: gang yang mngon par sangs ma rgyas pa ste /
translated: No one is currently fully awakening to it.

original: gang la gnyis su kun nas spyod pa yang med la gnyis su med par kun nas spyod pa yang med pa de ni chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid zab pa nyid do zhes bya ba 'di ni dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: gang la gnyis su kun nas spyod pa yang med la gnyis su med par kun nas spyod pa yang med pa de ni chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid zab pa nyid do zhes bya ba 'di ni dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
translated: The profound suchness of phenomena is that which is not engaged in dualistically, nor engaged in non-dualistically.

original: lha'i bu dag nam mkha' zab pa'i phyir chos 'di zab po //
analyzed: lha'i bu dag nam mkha' zab pa'i phyir chos 'di zab po //
translated: Gods, this teaching is profound because space is profound.

original: lha'i bu dag de bzhin nyid zab pa'i phyir chos 'di zab po //
analyzed: lha'i bu dag de bzhin nyid zab pa'i phyir chos 'di zab po //
translated: Gods, this teaching is profound because suchness is profound.

original: chos kyi dbyings zab pa'i phyir dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' zab pa'i phyir dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings zab pa'i phyir chos 'di zab po //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings zab pa'i phyir dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' zab pa'i phyir dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings zab pa'i phyir chos 'di zab po //
translated: Gods, this teaching is profound because the realm of phenomena is profound, because the perfect limit is profound, and because the inconceivable realm is profound.

original: lha'i bu dag nam mkha' mtha' yas mu med pa'i phyir dang / 'ong ba dang 'gro ba med pa'i phyir dang / mi skye mi 'gag par mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med par mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir dang /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag nam mkha' mtha' yas mu med pa'i phyir dang / 'ong ba dang 'gro ba med pa'i phyir dang / mi skye mi 'gag par mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med par mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir dang /
translated: Gods, this teaching is profound because space is infinite and boundless, because it is the same in not coming or going, because it is the same in not being produced or stopped, and because it is the same in not being defiled or purified.

original: mngon par 'du byed pa med par mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir dang / bdag zab pa'i phyir dang / sems can dang / srog dang / 'gro ba dang / gso ba dang / skyes bu dang / gang zag dang / shed can dang / shed bdag dang /🔽byed pa po dang / tshor ba po dang / shes pa po dang / mthong ba po zab pa'i phyir chos 'di zab po //🔽lha'i bu dag gzugs zab pa'i phyir chos 'di zab po //🔽tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa zab pa'i phyir chos 'di zab po //
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa med par mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir dang / bdag zab pa'i phyir dang / sems can dang / srog dang / 'gro ba dang / gso ba dang / skyes bu dang / gang zag dang / shed can dang / shed bdag dang / byed pa po dang / tshor ba po dang / shes pa po dang / mthong ba po zab pa'i phyir chos 'di zab po // lha'i bu dag gzugs zab pa'i phyir chos 'di zab po // tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa zab pa'i phyir chos 'di zab po //
translated: This doctrine is profound because of the profundity of the non-performance of action, the equality of the non-performance of action, the profundity of the self, and the profundity of sentient beings, living creatures, living organisms, persons, individuals, humankind, human beings, those born of Manu, and the sons of Manu.🔽This doctrine is profound because of the profundity of the agent, the experiencer, the knower, and the seer.🔽Gods, this doctrine is profound because of the profundity of form.🔽This doctrine is profound because of the profundity of feeling, notion, co-producing factors, and consciousness.🔽

original: lha'i bu dag phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched zab pa'i phyir chos 'di zab po //🔽rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zab pa'i phyir chos 'di zab po //
analyzed: lha'i bu dag phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched zab pa'i phyir chos 'di zab po // rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zab pa'i phyir chos 'di zab po //
translated: This doctrine is profound because of the profundity of the non-production of all things, because of the profundity of the non-production of all dharmas, because of the profundity of the non-production of the elements, because of the profundity of the non-production of the sense-fields, because of the profundity of the non-production of the perfections, because of the profundity of the non-production of the emptinesses, because of the profundity of the non-production of the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, because of the profundity of the non-production of the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, because of the profundity of the non-production of the knowledge of all aspects, and because of the profundity of the non-production of the knowledge of path aspects.

original: lha'i bu dag sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zab pa'i phyir chos 'di zab po //
analyzed: lha'i bu dag sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zab pa'i phyir chos 'di zab po //
translated: This doctrine is profound because of the profundity of the non-production of the perfection of giving, because of the profundity of the non-production of the perfection of morality, because of the profundity of the non-production of the perfection of patience, because of the profundity of the non-production of the perfection of perseverance, because of the profundity of the non-production of the perfection of concentration, and because of the profundity of the non-production of the perfection of wisdom.🔽This doctrine is profound because of the profundity of the non-production of the emptiness of emptiness, because of the profundity of the non-production of the emptiness of great extent, because of the profundity of the non-production of the emptiness of ultimate reality, because of the profundity of the non-production of the emptiness of conditioned phenomena, because of the profundity of the non-production of the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, because of the profundity of the non-production of the emptiness of the unlimited, because of the profundity of the non-production of the emptiness of the beginningless and endless, because of the profundity of the non-production of the emptiness of non-rejection, and because of the profundity of the non-production of the emptiness of inherent existence.🔽This doctrine is profound because of the profundity of the non-production of the applications of mindfulness, because of the profundity of the non-production of the right efforts, because of the profundity of the non-production of the legs of miraculous power, because of

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab @266a * //🔽pa'i phyir chos 'di zab po //🔽bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zab pa'i phyir chos 'di zab po //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab @266a * // pa'i phyir chos 'di zab po // bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zab pa'i phyir chos 'di zab po //
translated: “Divine princes, this teaching is profound because the perfection of morality is profound.🔽This teaching is profound because the perfection of patience is profound.

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab pa'i phyir chos 'di zab po //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab pa'i phyir chos 'di zab po //
translated: This teaching is profound because the perfection of perseverance is profound.

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab pa'i phyir chos 'di zab po //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab pa'i phyir chos 'di zab po //
translated: This teaching is profound because the perfection of concentration is profound.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab pa'i phyir chos 'di zab po //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab pa'i phyir chos 'di zab po //
translated: This teaching is profound because the perfection of wisdom is profound.

original: lha'i bu dag nang stong pa nyid zab pa'i phyir chos 'di zab po //
analyzed: lha'i bu dag nang stong pa nyid zab pa'i phyir chos 'di zab po //
translated: “Divine princes, this teaching is profound because inner emptiness is profound.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du zab pa'i phyir chos 'di zab po //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du zab pa'i phyir chos 'di zab po //
translated: This teaching is profound because up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature is profound.

original: lha'i bu dag dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zab pa'i phyir chos 'di zab po //
analyzed: lha'i bu dag dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zab pa'i phyir chos 'di zab po //
translated: “Divine princes, this teaching is profound because the applications of mindfulness are profound.

original: yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam rnams zab pa'i phyir chos 'di zab po //
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam rnams zab pa'i phyir chos 'di zab po //
translated: This doctrine is profound because of the profundity of the correct exertions, the supports for miraculous ability, the faculties, the powers, the branches of enlightenment, and the path.

original: lha'i bu dag tshad med pa dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams zab pa'i phyir chos 'di zab po //
analyzed: lha'i bu dag tshad med pa dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams zab pa'i phyir chos 'di zab po //
translated: Gods, this doctrine is profound because of the profundity of the immeasurables, the dhyānas, and the formless absorptions.

original: lha'i bu dag 'phags pa'i bden pa zab pa'i phyir chos 'di zab po //
analyzed: lha'i bu dag 'phags pa'i bden pa zab pa'i phyir chos 'di zab po //
translated: Gods, this doctrine is profound because of the profundity of the noble truths.

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa rnams zab pa'i phyir dang / mngon par shes pa rnams zab pa'i phyir dang / rnam par thar pa thams cad dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams zab pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa rnams zab pa'i phyir dang / mngon par shes pa rnams zab pa'i phyir dang / rnam par thar pa thams cad dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams zab pa'i phyir dang /
translated: Gods, this doctrine is profound because of the profundity of emptiness, signlessness, and aspirationlessness; because of the profundity of the higher knowledges; and because of the profundity of all the liberations, the meditative stabilizations, and the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams zab pa'i phyir dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad zab pa'i phyir dang / lha'i bu dag rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du zab pa'i phyir chos 'di zab bo //
analyzed: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams zab pa'i phyir dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad zab pa'i phyir dang / lha'i bu dag rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du zab pa'i phyir chos 'di zab bo //
translated: Because the ten powers, the fearlessnesses, and the detailed and thorough knowledges are deep, and because the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are deep, and because, divine princes, up to the knowledge of all aspects is deep, this doctrine is deep.

original: de skad cis bka' stsal pa dang / lha'i bu rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad cis bka' stsal pa dang / lha'i bu rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Lord having spoken thus, the divine princes said to him,

original: bcom ldan 'das chos bstan pa 'di ni 'jig rten thams cad dang mi mthun pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das chos bstan pa 'di ni 'jig rten thams cad dang mi mthun pa'o //
translated: “Lord, this doctrine that you teach is not in common with the whole world.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: bcom ldan 'das chos de ni gzugs gzung ba'am mi gzung ba'i slad du chos bstan pa ma lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das chos de ni gzugs gzung ba'am mi gzung ba'i slad du chos bstan pa ma lags /
translated: Lord, this doctrine is not taught for the sake of apprehending form or not apprehending it.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa gzung ba'am mi gzung ba'i slad du chos bstan pa ma lags /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa gzung ba'am mi gzung ba'i slad du chos bstan pa ma lags /
translated: It is not taught for the sake of apprehending or not apprehending feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.

original: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag gzung ba'am mi gzung ba'i slad du chos bstan pa ma lags /
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag gzung ba'am mi gzung ba'i slad du chos bstan pa ma lags /
translated: It is not for the sake of grasping or not grasping the aggregates, elements, sense sources, dependent origination, or the links of dependent origination that the Dharma is taught.

original: de bzhin du stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos @266b sum cu rtsa bdun rnams dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad rnams gzung ba'am mi gzung ba'i slad du bstan pa ma lags /
analyzed: de bzhin du stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos @266b sum cu rtsa bdun rnams dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad rnams gzung ba'am mi gzung ba'i slad du bstan pa ma lags /
translated: Similarly, it is not for the sake of grasping or not grasping all the aspects of emptiness, the thirty-seven aspects of awakening, the ten powers, the four forms of fearlessness, the four forms of correct understanding, or the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha that the Dharma is taught.

original: chos thams cad gzung ba'am mi gzung ba'i slad du bstan pa ma lags /
analyzed: chos thams cad gzung ba'am mi gzung ba'i slad du bstan pa ma lags /
translated: It is not for the sake of grasping or not grasping any phenomena that the Dharma is taught.

original: bcom ldan 'das chos 'di ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu gzung ba'am mi gzung ba'i slad du bstan pa ma lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das chos 'di ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu gzung ba'am mi gzung ba'i slad du bstan pa ma lags /
translated: Blessed One, this Dharma is not taught for the sake of grasping or not grasping the result of stream enterer.

original: de bzhin du lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du gzung ba'am mi gzung ba'i slad du bstan pa ma lags /
analyzed: de bzhin du lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du gzung ba'am mi gzung ba'i slad du bstan pa ma lags /
translated: Similarly, it is not for the sake of apprehending or not apprehending the result of once-returner, the result of non-returner, the state of a worthy one, a pratyekabuddha’s awakening, or even the knowledge of all aspects.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten ni bdag gi gzugs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten ni bdag gi gzugs so //
translated: “Blessed One, the world is ‘my form,’

original: bdag gi tshor ba'o //
analyzed: bdag gi tshor ba'o //
translated: ‘my feeling,’

original: bdag gi 'du shes so //
analyzed: bdag gi 'du shes so //
translated: ‘my perception,’

original: bdag gi 'du byed rnams so //
analyzed: bdag gi 'du byed rnams so //
translated: ‘my volitional factors,’

original: bdag gi rnam par shes pa'o //🔽bdag gi phung po rnams so //🔽bdag gi khams rnams so //
analyzed: bdag gi rnam par shes pa'o // bdag gi phung po rnams so // bdag gi khams rnams so //
translated: ‘my consciousness,’🔽‘my aggregates,’🔽‘my constituents,’

original: bdag gi skye mched rnams so //🔽bdag gi rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: bdag gi skye mched rnams so // bdag gi rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'o //
translated: ‘my sense fields,’🔽‘my dependent origination,’

original: bdag gi rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag go //
analyzed: bdag gi rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag go //
translated: ‘my links of dependent origination,’

original: bdag gi sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gi sbyin pa'o //
translated: ‘my generosity,’

original: bdag ni sbyin bdag go //
analyzed: bdag ni sbyin bdag go //
translated: ‘I am a benefactor,’

original: bdag gi tshul khrims rnams so //
analyzed: bdag gi tshul khrims rnams so //
translated: ‘my morality,’

original: bdag ni tshul khrims dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ni tshul khrims dang ldan pa'o //
translated: ‘I am moral,’

original: bdag gi bzod pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gi bzod pa'o //
translated: ‘my patience,’

original: bdag ni bzod pa dang ldan pa'o //🔽bdag gi brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: bdag ni bzod pa dang ldan pa'o // bdag gi brtson 'grus so //
translated: I have patience.🔽I have perseverance.

original: bdag ni brtson 'grus dang ldan pa'o //🔽bdag gi bsam gtan no //
analyzed: bdag ni brtson 'grus dang ldan pa'o // bdag gi bsam gtan no //
translated: I am persevering.🔽I have concentration.

original: bdag ni bsam gtan dang ldan pa'o //🔽bdag gi shes rab po //
analyzed: bdag ni bsam gtan dang ldan pa'o // bdag gi shes rab po //
translated: I am concentrated.🔽I have wisdom.

original: bdag ni shes rab dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ni shes rab dang ldan pa'o //
translated: I am wise.

original: bdag gi nang stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: bdag gi nang stong pa nyid do //
translated: I have inner emptiness.

original: bdag ni nang stong pa nyid sgom pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ni nang stong pa nyid sgom pa'o //
translated: I meditate on inner emptiness.

original: bdag gi dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar ro //
analyzed: bdag gi dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar ro //
translated: I have emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.

original: bdag ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar sgom pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar sgom pa'o //
translated: I meditate on emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.

original: bdag gi dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams so //
analyzed: bdag gi dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams so //
translated: I have the applications of mindfulness.

original: bdag gi yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam rnams so //
analyzed: bdag gi yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam rnams so //
translated: I have the right efforts, legs of miraculous power, faculties, powers, limbs of awakening, and path.

original: bdag gi tshad med pa dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / bdag gi 'phags pa'i bden ba rnams dang / bdag gi mngon par shes pa rnams dang / bdag gi rnam bar thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang /
analyzed: bdag gi tshad med pa dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / bdag gi 'phags pa'i bden ba rnams dang / bdag gi mngon par shes pa rnams dang / bdag gi rnam bar thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang /
translated: “My immeasurables, my concentrations, my formless absorptions, my noble truths, my superknowledges, my liberations, my meditative stabilizations,

original: snyoms par 'jug pa @267a * //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa @267a * //
translated: my meditative absorptions,

original: dang ; gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / bdag gi stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa rnams so //
analyzed: dang ; gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / bdag gi stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa rnams so //
translated: my dhāraṇī gateways, my emptiness, my signlessness, and my wishlessness.

original: bdag ni stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa rnams dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ni stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa rnams dang ldan pa'o //
translated: I am endowed with emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: bdag gi stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams so //
analyzed: bdag gi stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams so //
translated: “My ten powers, my fearlessnesses, and my detailed and thorough knowledges,

original: bdag gi sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / bdag gi rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: bdag gi sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / bdag gi rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: my eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, and my fruit of entering the stream.

original: bdag ni rgyun du zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ni rgyun du zhugs pa'o //
translated: I am a stream enterer.

original: bdag gi lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: bdag gi lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: This is my result of once-returner.

original: bdag ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: bdag ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'o //
translated: I am a once-returner.

original: bdag gi phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: bdag gi phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: This is my result of non-returner.

original: bdag ni phyir mi 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: bdag ni phyir mi 'ong ba'o //
translated: I am a non-returner.

original: bdag gi dgra bcom pa nyid do //
analyzed: bdag gi dgra bcom pa nyid do //
translated: This is my state of arhatship.

original: bdag ni dgra bcom pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ni dgra bcom pa'o //
translated: I am an arhat.

original: bdag gi rang byang chub po //
analyzed: bdag gi rang byang chub po //
translated: This is my individual enlightenment.

original: bdag ni rang sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: bdag ni rang sangs rgyas so //
translated: I am a pratyekabuddha.

original: bdag gi rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do //
analyzed: bdag gi rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do //
translated: This is my omniscience.

original: bdag ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'o zhes bya bar 'dzin pa la spyod do //
analyzed: bdag ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'o zhes bya bar 'dzin pa la spyod do //
translated: I am endowed with omniscience.’

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: lha'i bu dag de de bzhin no //
analyzed: lha'i bu dag de de bzhin no //
translated: “Divine princes, it is so!

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said!

original: lha'i bu dag chos 'di ni gzugs gzung ba'i phyir bstan pa ma yin /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag chos 'di ni gzugs gzung ba'i phyir bstan pa ma yin /
translated: Divine princes, this Dharma is not taught for the sake of apprehending form,

original: mi gzung ba'i phyir bstan pa ma yin /
analyzed: mi gzung ba'i phyir bstan pa ma yin /
translated: nor is it taught for the sake of not apprehending it.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa gzung ba'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa gzung ba'i phyir ma yin /
translated: It is not taught for the sake of apprehending feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness,

original: mi gzung ba'i phyir ma yin te /
analyzed: mi gzung ba'i phyir ma yin te /
translated: It is not for the purpose of not apprehending.

original: lha'i bu dag gang yang gzugs gzung ba'i phyir spyod pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / gang rnam par shes pa gzung ba'i phyir spyod pa de dag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa'i skal ba dang ldan ba ma yin no //
analyzed: lha'i bu dag gang yang gzugs gzung ba'i phyir spyod pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / gang rnam par shes pa gzung ba'i phyir spyod pa de dag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa'i skal ba dang ldan ba ma yin no //
translated: Divine princes, those who practice for the purpose of apprehending form, and those who practice for the purpose of apprehending feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness, they are not fortunate to cultivate the perfection of wisdom.

original: gang phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba gzung ba'i phyir bstan pa ma yin /
analyzed: gang phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba gzung ba'i phyir bstan pa ma yin /
translated: It is not taught for the purpose of apprehending the aggregates, constituents, sense fields, and dependent origination.

original: mi gzung ba'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: mi gzung ba'i phyir ma yin /
translated: It is not for the purpose of not apprehending.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gzung ba'i phyir bstan pa ma yin /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gzung ba'i phyir bstan pa ma yin /
translated: It is not taught for the purpose of apprehending all the perfections, all the emptinesses, and the thirty-seven factors of awakening.

original: mi gzung ba'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: mi gzung ba'i phyir ma yin /
translated: It is not for the purpose of not apprehending.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /🔽smon pa med pa gzung ba'i phyir bstan pa ma yin /🔽@267b mi gzung ba'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa gzung ba'i phyir bstan pa ma yin / @267b mi gzung ba'i phyir ma yin /
translated: the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the liberations, the correct and discerning knowledges,🔽the meditative stabilizations, the dhāraṇī gateways, the ten powers of a tathāgata, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion,🔽the distinct attributes of a buddha,🔽the knowledge of all aspects,🔽the knowledge of path aspects,
